Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

itHdp-ON1bniIHRHN97Gtg.text: I come here anytime I have a special occasion, so good, quality food, however sometimes it seems it can be hit or miss on the fish tacos, I've gone and sometimes it's really good, then other times it's not very good at all. Still very good though and they have vegan and vegetarian options!! Love the decor of the place too!v :)

viRlNnCCu25ntJ2GkhqRRg.text: Overpriced food but my margarita was decent. This place is one of those trendy, fast food type places. Food is meh, ambiance does not facilitate hanging out for long. There are many better places to get tacos in town the trick os finding one with beer and/or liquor.

248QFknMQOPgHn6pyl4mgg.text: Fresh tortillas made right in front of the kitchen. Lively atmosphere. Service was ok they forgot to place the order for empanadas I wanted with my guacamole as an app but guacamole was very good. Tacos good. The fried fish one was excellent. The steak hurache was good but coldish. Prices are good. Nice place to hang and get some Mexican food.

x2IazBmp35TzGom5QudCeA.text: It was a fun and friendly place for a Tuesday night. Our server was helpful with the drink choices and menu. The music could use some work though.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche, with avocado, jalapeño and red onions! Love it.

rg0aGv70tw7htQDTbF074w.text: I love this place! My coworkers and I come all the time. It is always busy, but you never have to wait too long for a table as they turn over quickly. They serve small Mexican street-style tacos that are sure to please everyone. They also offer three vegan taco options, plus a few vegetarian ones you can ask to leave the dairy off of. Their customer service is amazing and they won't hesitate to fix any issues you may have. The beer list is great too. I would love to see them add some vegan dessert options.

S37MGwfsY_tVBn2iW3VyKQ.text: This place is mediocre, for a place that's called Tacos and Beer their carne asada tacos were meh. I've had better from food trucks in LA.  Service was a bit slow, but the place was packed. Their fish tacos were the best!!! Better than all the other 6 different ones my hubby and I tried. I'd go again but only for the fish tacos.

-NL2N3wiveM4zEQ47Dvucw.text: I can't say enough good things about this place , an absolute gem in the heart of Las Vegas. The real deal Holyfield of authentic tacos , but let me tell it doesn't stop there they have hands down theeeee beast tap beer selection off the strip, from the guacamole to Guero taco to Asada tacos will leave you wanting more, handmade tortillas and homemade everything makes you feel like you're in Mexico somewhere, they're always jamming good music, the staff is bilingual meaning the servers provide that extra flavor you won't get at taco hell or any other wannabe taco places. Everything I've had, I've enjoyed and is very very tasty. My favorite Mexican in Vegas hands down for a party in your mouth where all flavors are coming. Nom nom nom nom

wzC9kqqlF3sI_JaeeS0Xtw.text: Meh. Tacos weren't that great and over priced (except for being in Vegas) our served was nice & let us make changes to the tacos to satisfy our picky tastes :) you could definitely taste the tequila in our margarita which I guess is a good thing for some. Chips and salsa not included. Small salsa cups and extra if you need more. I also was not a fan of the queso. Had to change my star rating the more i think about it. Good service but overall 3/4 of us in the party did not care for our food which is surprising in a group of people who love tacos!

JaHJtBP8TkOphKnbUzUbag.text: Best spot to grab delicious tacos!! Local vibe. Awesome staff. Skyler!!! You're the best!! Will be back again for sure.

sml0Y4ktNAgmUBM2DUJ_6w.text: The restaurant was nice & quiet. I had the green enchiladas & they were great! The sauce had a light lime flavor but was tasty. The beans & rice were also good. However, I had Agua de Jamaica to drink & it was too sweet, would not recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L0TR3L-T9mMEJ-51CRvMJw.text: We came in here after one of the bartenders at the craft burger recommended this place. We ordered a steak burrito and tacos and had chip beans and salsa. Everything was killer. We will be back again when we're back in Vegas

aBe6TNR2Xhn3Wj7hg9uOzA.text: Use to be a really good place to go when it was techno Tuesday. Service is mediocre now very slow. Food is good not special.

viXEG_9JxwNlpqOW1mCtww.text: Nice place to hang out.  Good drinks and food. Customer service it's good and the ambience it's great. Totally a nice chill place.  A bit to expensive tho.

xsF3FXJivC3vDqCJmECbLQ.text: Three Vegan Tacos on the menu! I was impressed before I even took my first bite. They also had veggie options and a creative list of cocktails. It's a fun environment and reasonably priced. This place is getting bookmarked for sure. The great service was the cherry on top.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More tacos and some sides. Delicioso!
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the menu. More non-taco options on the back.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is jumping on a Taco Tuesday.

Kpa0bkL1XKwP42WXDqke1A.text: Late night snack after a day on the strip. Food and service were amazing. Highly recommend. Our waiter Alberto gave us some amazing suggestions. The flan was the best we have ever tasted.

fYSo7Bgarewb1-bS5ulJyw.text: Great tacos and atmosphere on a crowded busy night.   Entering this place was like walking into a late night lounge. On this Friday 9pm visit, the place was packed (inside and out) with every seat filled, under the dimly lit, hanging electric candle lights. The place is very clean and tidy, decorative and stylish, all fitting for a return visit.   While getting service wasn't an issue, it seemed the kind crew was understaffed on this busy night. I saw maybe two waitresses in a room that probably packs 60+. I think even the bussers helped refill waters and chips.   BEER: I went for something new and different with the Gose Gone Wild Tijuana ($9 in an 12oz. sniffer glass). A bit sweet then immediately sour. Not my thing so I fell back to a safe beer, Corona, to compliment the tacos.   3 TACOS: BBQ Beef ($3.70), Lengua ($3.70), Grilled Fish ($4.15). Damn, they were all bomb with BBQ Beef being favorite - it just had an awesome marinade to it. I only had three on this evening - there's probably a dozen more to try.   Great food. Will come again to try new beers and tacos. On a busy night, it's a good spot to get in and get out. But I think the experience could be better on a slower night.

Sj1V09MRyj3JZcZZkUXXSQ.text: Went last night. Good food and service. Coincidence that I woke up to an Amex email about fraudulent charges on the credit card I had just used at this location the night before? Will never know!

06bx0XGzu4fc6PAcDr2vIA.text: Came here to have tacos and a beer.  Had an awesome beer from their extensive eclectic beer menu.  I had read that the tacos were above average in size, so I ordered two ... one pork and one chicken.  They have several varieties in pork, chicken, beef, fish, etc.  When the tacos came, they were average (or maybe a bit below average) in size, so I ordered a third taco (beef this time).  All three tacos were very good.  I thought the food was maybe a bit overpriced for what you get and for the atmosphere (nothing special).

HOXtk51xIGtWb_y_QKw5zA.text: This place has amazing food.  Good happy hour.  Good drinks.  Nice staff.  They have fallen into the ridiculous Vegas mentality that pumping bass helps a restaurant- Sunday's and Tuesday's.  They just started this trend.  It's a terrible choice in my opinion.  People were constantly asking for it to be turned down.  It is saddening that management has decided to fall victim to the whole Vegas idea of loud repetitive music rather than catering to locals like they used to.  It would be 5 star but the music is a serious deterrent.  Sad.

dcepXwatWuehY8P7__OsFg.text: Went after a recommendation from a friend Large selection of fair prices tacos. We had crispy chickens, carnitas and I forgot the third. Carne Asada fries had a lot of toppings. Too bad the chips & salsa aren't complimentary.

CrQFWrW8zV4glEFQvCfWcg.text: Louis was a wonderful server!!! Excellent food and event better drinks! A place to go on a night out or a rough work week.

nW-ATyaNKi-ZPCAb8PsyJA.text: I absolutely love this restaurant. If you're looking for authentic Mexican food, it's not the place to be. But if you are looking for exceptionally tasty "mexican enough" food, this is the spot to be. Their taco selection is extensive, I'm a huge fan of their al pastor and baja fish. Puerco verde is delicious as well. Tons of beers on tap, hip interior design, and great overall ambiance.   The only draw back is that this place is a tad pricey for what you get (each taco and side is ordered individually). If you have an average appetite, it's no big deal. You really do get the quality that you pay for. However, if you have a bigger appetite you, might be a bit less satisfied with what you'll spend to fill up.  I would be there every Taco Tuesday if I wasn't worried about my waistline!

PhfUq_r0S68EchJAoolI2Q.text: This is one of my favorite spots in town! I come here maybe twice or three times a month. The service is always great! Delicious tacos, quesadillas, the Michelada mix...everything bomb! But today's service was exceptional, the server Frank took great care of us...very attentive and brought out everything we had asked for with a wonderful attitude. We also happened to leave our credit card and he ran out to return it to us! Thanks Frank! #tacosandbeer

ltN53NKvYVMvrgvhPHsSpQ.text: Great restaurant from the moment we entered the door. Our server Alyssa and all the staff were on top of everything, didn't have to ask for a thing. Great place to eat, sit, and chat. The manager was respectful and took care of us. Will definitely come back soon, 10/10!

2xQIRcr-2fPNQ3XOKlQ5AA.text: I have been dinning here for the past five years and I considered myself a loyal customer. I have even bought merchandise (techno taco Tuesday shirts) I've taken several friends and family here because I love this place the food is amazing and the servers and bartenders are super friendly But last night 3/6/18 at the t-t-t event Manuel the restaurant manager asked me to leave for an unnecessary reason I have never misbehaved at this place and I'm a very laid-back guy and very friendly for him to humiliate and disrespect me the way he did last night for something so insignificant. it's totally not right and extremely disrespectful to treat a long time  customer the way he did. I will no longer be coming here ever again thanks to Manuel next time please consider hiring someone who is truly professional in managing this place because if he treated me like crap I can imagine how he can treat any other customer.

aeOC3JFtbne4JMzIwtWvIA.text: I don't trust any Mexican restaurant that charges for chips and salsa, but that's the thing, this isn't a Mexican taco place, it's a hipster taco place. And while the food was tasty, I'd rather go to a "lesser" restaurant and get twice the food for the same price.

CsGfiSW6hcYVd_4pGZBBPA.text: This is a very amercianized Mexican place, but the food is really, really good. I had a carne asada burrito and it was awesome. They also had a great selection of hot sauces.

5WAsnech5tGNWWZI0u70gg.text: Frank is the man. I ate 5 tacos. They were all delicious. From awesome to great, I'd rank them as shrimp, all pastor, bbq, Carne asada, and pork shoulder. Chips and salsa were tremendous. Service from Frank - top notch and had beautiful eyes.

_x6EdtLS3ABiVaW8tuS1sg.text: I travel a lot and you find these gems along the way. They even serve the white........wait for it......tacos( that means corn, not processed flour )  Great bar, atmosphere, food( beef tongue for the first time, yum) and service.  'If you are near' you must come here' (tm)

FQyXUSuh72n-O-JoERC92A.text: This was the first time I have been and took family visiting to this place. Prices were good individual tacos were about 3.50 each and considered street taco size. They were amply filled. One corn tortilla for each taco which kind if annoyed me because anyone knows you should always use two to support the filling so it doesn't all fall apart which is what it did. Not sure if this is normal or they decided to cheap their guests because the majority are tourists. Couldn't tell how the drinks were but they did have an extensive cocktail, beer and wine list. An ok spot if your looking for cheap eats but I've had better at fast food taco shops around the city.

7CR6ufHoFz8sJPGg32QrRw.text: This was our first time here and we ran into people we knew that suggested we get the guacamole with the pomegranate and said it was an orgasm in your mouth, so we ordered that expecting the same. However, our waiter was too busy and just gave us the plain version so I was super disappointed that I couldn't experience the amazing food! Bummer.

SkhaVMf5Z5ZIJ8CF3Cg-zg.text: Happy hour is pretty good here 3 bucks for beer and the puerco tacos are to die for!!! The prices for regular menu aren't that bad either

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ycHzY3_vO8bifLpU4RVywQ.text: Yeah, I don't know what I like better the tacos, the beer, or our server, Frank.  :)  It literally feels like we were dining at a friends house when we come here.  Baja fish and the lengua are our our go-to picks, but the T&B salad (with steak!) and the enchiladas are winners too.  My only question is...how do I get a frequent diner punch-card? o_O

TFNJiN_dAQbLjIOBQKc8Fg.text: If you want some amazing super authentic tacos, this is the place to go. Great atmosphere, very friendly staff, and awesome food makes for an enjoyable meal. The reasons for the 4 star rating are: the side of rice was extremely salty, and more so because my wife asked about her taco being spicy and was assured it wasn't and the salsa would be placed on the side. Although the salsa was on the side the chicken season was pretty spicy. Would think the server would have mentioned that.

oZaNR6RzaiaPdS6XCS3CAg.text: This place does what it's named after real well. There's a large selection of tacos. The server Frank helped us pick and explain how each taco was different. The pork al pastor and lingua were my favorites #TacosAndBeerOP #localspot

UROeaMAfJbL0-78RTdBMNw.text: I was in here more than a month ago, but after traveling cross country with my husband, I finally had the time to write a review about my favorite taco and craft beer place that contends with every place in this country. We came here on a Wednesday night. The hostesses knew what they were doing, which if you eat out as much as we do, you know the best indication of quality service starts with hostesses who know what they are doing.   We got seated outside because it was a great afternoon outside, and the patio was where we wanted to enjoy some amazing tacos. The tacos were authentic. Our server, Alan, knew what he was talking about. Every question we asked him, he answered us with a knowledgeable answer, and when he didn't really know questions about the wine selection, he asked the manager, Armando, who came up to us with a professional manner and answered our questions with amazing knowledge. We could tell he wasn't  hired from the outside. He was a server who worked his butt off to be a knowledgeable manager who helps his servers, bartenders, and bussers without question. Seriously, he was bussing tables and helping the restaurant without being judgemental.   We are from San Francisco, which our server Alan was also from, so when we are in Vegas eating at Tacos & Beer, we will be asking to be served by Alan, who has impressive customer service skills, and Jordan, who made the most amazing cocktails...seriously, try the Hicubus Mezcal, best cocktail I've ever drank.

Qs2EIOiM7Egb8TE9IalQVg.text: It doesn't get any better than this. Like 20 different kinds of tacos all a la carte, between $2.50 and $3.95. 2 of them and you're pretty full, 3 of them and you're stuffed. Staff is always super friendly and they come around to refill your water often,  ambiance has a buzz (especially on Techno Taco Tuesday, where they have a live DJ spinning all night) place is open late night which is huge, and the lighting is awesome with all of the votive candles re-purposed as lights. Bacon wrapped cream cheese stuffed Jalapenos are a must and are to die for. Flan is very rich and perfect sized. Alberto served me the other night and he was very attentive and fast with taking care of everything. This place needs to multiply soon.

eHuCAi0yvfMf_Z7KGR736w.text: Great location and awesome late night local place! Diverse beer list with the best bottle and draft beer prices in town. Laid back and cool new place to check out

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v_tmBCBP629ryMJ4uGK-oA.text: AWESOM!!!   Great food, great beer and great service. Fresh made tortillas!!!!  The freshest fish tacos!!!  Corn salad was great along with the black beans!!!   Will eat there the next time!!!   Cool place to go.  Nice selection of bees!!!!!   And reasonable prices!!!!   Get off the strip and EAT there!!!

6exlXZ_GRKVDUaoLfBCJAg.text: Rating businesses on a 5-star system can be uncomfortable. We've been accustomed to thinking that only a 4-5 star restaurant is acceptable but please remember that 3-stars in YELP means "A-OK" which in my book, means I would return.  Came in Sunday afternoon for a quick bite to eat at the recommendation of a friend. Within our group of four, none of us had been there before but were all happy with the food.   We had a couple of instances where our server may have gotten overwhelmed. We were her first table, but quickly picked up 3-5 more tables and that could have crossed her threshold of comfort. She was VERY sweet and we did not pressure her. From our table, three of us had been bartenders/servers so although we were understanding, our expectations were higher.   Our guacamole was asked to be served without pumpkin seeds, it came with. We were given an additional guacamole as compensation. One of our tacos was asked to be served without the traditional flour tortilla, it came with the flour tortilla. There were just a few instances where our very specific dietary requests were not met.   Regardless, the food was pretty decent. I was not impressed with their chicken taco but was very happy with the pork (had pineapple in it too). For the bigger eater, the bill can run a bit high than you might expect but you can tell this is absolutely a great spot for happy hour.  We will be back!

YzWaeUDzrNuQVezsdd8Adw.text: The Vibe In This Place Is Amazing! The Candle Chandelier vibe was my favorite thing that really made me enjoy being in there! lol Plus My Taco's where soooo good! (beer battered baja style tacos) I wish I had some right now!! ^__^

CgH1DH_e1qk9xggzrW_wlA.text: Tacos and Beer delivers. Thank you Alan for your hospitality, excellent food, and great beer...don't change a thing!

4lGg1Rwr2pU29pKSfdV_sQ.text: Tried this place for a quick lunch near the Convention Center. Service was not good. The hostess ended up being our waitress too, and she was unfriendly from the moment we entered the door. The bartender looked like he was offering much better service but unfortunately we were seated in the main dining room and experienced the slow and unfriendly service instead.   I ordered a soft drink & it literally took between 5-10 minutes. She wanted to take our order as soon as we sat down but since it was our first visit we needed a moment with the menu. It took another almost 10 minutes for her to return. It wasn't as it they were slammed or too busy, just bad service.  That being said, the food was really good & I would be willing to give it another shot sometime, maybe for happy hour.

qRmtl0ikLCaCHANJCbxp3w.text: Came here for dinner today, (Tuesday)  The service was GREAT, very attentive, and quick! The tacos were delicious. The handmade tortillas really add to the taste. We tried just about every taco on the menu. The ones that really stood out were the Puerco Verde Taco, Adobada Taco, Al Pastor and Crunchy Taco. These were absolutely amazing. We did not enjoy the Carne Asada taco or shrimp taco as much as the others, but they were okay.  The chips and salsa were fresh. All around great food, keep it up!

Lc68sWTzLg00ty7_5z84ZQ.text: Driving down Paradise on the way to the convention center and my wife was hungry so we stopped in.  Really good food.  Good chips, good salsa.  Her taco was fresh and delicious.    The waitress was really accommodating to all our requests.    If your thinking about eating here give it a try.

PHUPfuPE-nYdWXEj_HDJDA.text: The guys and crew are amazing plus super amazing tacos. Plenty aguacate on top and the tacos with HAND MADE TORTILLAS !!! PLUS the manager gave us free drinks because a mistake was made on the drinks. It was super attentitive. Definitely as local anmd mexican i am coming back over and over.

mCdQD-dVb7hKivkJjCNi3A.text: Hands down, best tacos in Vegas! Great selection of craft beer and the staff is amazing, highly recommend.

YrXt-wb6piQuXWTLNyvtTQ.text: I am staying at the Residence Inn and was looking for a late lunch. Was contemplating the Sub Shop next door but saw the sign "Tacos & Beer" and thought what could be better than that! I was pleased with the blues filled bar and many taps. The menu is simple alacart style and you can mix your order any way you like. Prices are low and the food was off the charts good. Oh did I mention happy hour from 3-6 and 11 to close with $3 Mexican beer, $4 Margaritas and a great selection of tacos for $2 & $3. This is going to be my regular stop for the best tacos around.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VsuV2txVdXsrmM0NtvrVRw.text: This place is great. It's got a cool atmosphere and a good selection of beer. The fish tacos and the best. And be sure to get chips and try their green sauce.

KXfWoMeoftx3kuBOu6jcOw.text: Food was freaky good omg. But the service was kinda bad. Smh I think next time we will sit at the bar then or Order Togo. I was really confused a lot of people took are order.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BscxrgArHSK4HTU_WJoGEw.text: i am so glad i tried this place, i was there last saturday and i came back today, the have my favorite beers dogfish 120, cantillon sour , i tried an italian IPA that they recommended it was delicious they have that on draft.  service was great, very friendly staff and everyone very attentive i sat at the bar and jesus was the bartender cool guy very knowledgeable. the place is super cool. the decoration is unique, best tacos in las vegas, im from mexico and i know about tacos, these are different but good, they use traditional mexican ingredients, but the decoration is fancy...... i tried all the deserts and my favorite was the flan......

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PbM0XeXEfG-Pu4NyxrqxUQ.text: How can you go wrong with a name like Tacos and Beer? I was presently surprised with great food. We had the guacamole which was outstanding, bacon wrapped jalapenos, beer queso, and then awesome super flavorful tacos. I recommend the Baja fish and Al Pastor.

nIUdiMA2Yc54bpZij3tfUQ.text: Not only was the food fuego, but the jalapeno Margherita was everything I could've hoped for. Our server Justin was on the beat with his recommendations, almost as hot as the beats he dropped.

bupcilwnx-Rt6OfIulzEZA.text: Fantastic food, all the tacos are great, the flan is awesome too. Been in Vegas three days and have been here twice already. Service is good, even though it was busy both times we stopped.

Y8g3jIpIHWf1zOjRzYwSnw.text: Been there 2x both times tacos were delicious! Servers need a lil more help getting the drinks out faster but the food is great! Can't wait to go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour! Chicken taco, Baja taco, shrimp taco! Delicious

pEDSlPVPQDcSPZkQVbvmlw.text: I came here on a Tuesday night for Techno Taco Tuesdays. Their complimentary chips and salsa were good. Their salsa is not spicy. It's the slushy, mild kind. Their tacos were $2 that night. Their tacos normally are $3-$4 each. I already had an early dinner so only got two tacos- beef adobada and the veggie potato cheese taco. The tacos are small.  They have a very impressive craft beer selection. However, they need to know their beers. My husband ordered an IPA and one of the Belgian beers for the second round. The second beer tasted exactly like the first beer. When we asked the waiter, he said it was the right order. Uh, OK? My friend ordered an amber ale but they gave him one of the IPAs.  I came here again the following week. The second time here, they forgot my friend's taco. No biggie, it happens. I got the carne asada and the veggie taco since I liked that one the last time. Carne asada was OK. Not bad or the best.  I would come back during HH and please make sure you give people the right beer please!

B6XtcDy_TQ0cqgZmGvzM8g.text: I chose this restaurant for a celebration dinner with my coworkers. I set a reservation for a party of 15 at 8:30pm. At 7:50pm, I receive a call from the hostess letting me know that they will not be honoring my reservation. When I asked why, she said "well someone should've let you know earlier. Someone was supposed to call you, but it's Taco Tuesday so we don't take reservations." She couldn't be bothered to even apologize for the inconvenience. I informed her that obviously someone had taken my reservation and I had a large party. She said that if I got there by 8:15, they would put us on the wait list now and have us seated then. So I rushed down there, and when I arrived, the same hostess then told me that it would be another half hour wait. We waited for an hour. The hostess sends me the text letting us know that our table is ready, so all 15 of us head in. She then lets us know that the table isn't really ready yet, but she just wanted us to "be ready so we wouldn't lose our t." So now there are 15 people clogging up their entry way and blocking the only exit for an additional 5 minutes. They finally seat us, and the tacos were amazing as always. Our server was great! I truly love the tacos here.  I wish they had better management and hosting staff. Truly horrendous. No matter how much I love the serving staff and the food, my party of 15 will never eat here again.

8nEriYXxadW4vgIrl1SJ0Q.text: Franco was awesome. Such great suggestions and an overall stellar and attentive server. My mom and I came to vegas on a business trip and were so grateful to be recommended this place. Such affordable tacos and margarita pitchers!!! Best taco options I've ever seen. Generally really happy about the place and would come back and recommend tacos and beer in a heart beat.

Yn3XK0ryue7FLjYSGz-G7A.text: Service was good. Food was tasty. Restaurant was clean.  There wasn't an "Open" sign lit so I didn't know they were open until I tried to open a door. Also I had no clue which door to go into as it wasn't properly labeled.

iS0ZbVHy1sz6BzP9l2_V3w.text: Been here several times and really enjoy this place. The only complaint would be the service has been a little slow(not enough to stop me from growing back). Great selection of food and beer.  Prices are great too (Half price beer for happy hour).   I've tried most of the tacos on the menu and my favorites have been Chicken Tinga & Puerco Verde.  Their Guacamole, corn salad, and cilantro lime rice are great too.

fhZvgjAUMkygwLo8wW9smQ.text: Best tacos ever and great selection on the beers, should try the puerco verde and adobada!  Best food,bar,customer service ever.  Best new spot on vegas!!!!

ssd1013qPCTmKeFSxZ-1hQ.text: Love the food here.  This is our second time here and AGAIN everything is awesome . Margaritas were wonderful  as well

X7ITI3HQ4ALV8HwsLLBilg.text: Awesome spot. Sat at the bar for Happy Hr. Marg and Tacos. Great ambiance and service. Ben the Host/Waiter who helped out from the start was fantastic. Bartenders were superb as well. Highly recommend

VuDPKniEy2RPDUeBaae_oQ.text: Had a great taco Tuesday... the food was delicious... Armando our waiter and server was an exceptional server .... the whole staff made sure we were taken care of... definitely a must for taco Tuesdays...

7Jm7tCmUHt6pbGvO4Lr6KQ.text: Really loved it, tacos were amazing and great beer selection.  Clean and good service.  Surprised they aren't busier on Saturday lunch but I think they are just starting to be known.

iS89wlmwWFHbgj6j14YycQ.text: Had a dozen street tacos which included barbacoa, carnitas,chicken, veggie(mushrooms) & bean and  cheese. All of which were mighty delicious. Along with freshly made guacamole. Guacamole was fantastic! Margarita pitcher worth it! Ordered a side of muddled jalapenos to add to the traditional Margarita, makes it pop! Service was OUTSTANDING! Especially for how busy it was. Beer selection is super! Best dessert ever and a must have every time: CHOCO TACOS! BOMBNESS! Exited to come back here and try full size tacos and ceviche. Thank you to all staff and management.

1AZ9xEDNkEHnnx2AYT8J_A.text: Such good food! 3 vegetarian tacos & tons of other options. Literally I e eaten here twice & will continue to come back. Skully is a pretty good server!

FmDVoE8uKq1enpZW9xFSrA.text: Best tacos I've ever had! The beer menu is diverse enough for a connoisseur; yet, the Margaritas are it's at. Service is 5 star...special thanks to Oscar, Franco and, of course, to the outstanding professionalism of the manager, Carlos. Carlos was especially kind: my Siberian Husky service dog, Bear, whom I trust my life to, was given water and ice and pampered. Any Husky appreciates such treatment in the blazing Mojave to be sure...so all Service Dog handlers, here's your place to go for awesome food and a warm welcome. Excellent value, too!

JFxK3SS2NTJ0LnPNTg0MHg.text: Great great restaurant! 100% mexican everything super fresh. Salsas are home made, real guacamole. Karla and Ruy excellent service. Options gluten free and vegan. Excellent prices.

DygSQVoUXGCyH7v1IjI4qA.text: I absolutely love tacos and beer !! Everything is finger licking good. I've been coming here since it opened and not only is it good but very affordable highly recommend

KSepV7whHT5tC1tEFtip1A.text: Here on business and trying to find places off the strip.  The salsa and chips were wonderful....very cold beer and the best tacos ever. Will be back in November....

2BGD94X9Nrat4BtERo9oNg.text: came on a Thursday night. had the shrimp, baja fish and barbacoa tacos. they were all decent, nothing to really rave about. wait time was about 30 min. waiter was attentive but got all the orders wrong and tried to compensate by giving us free tacos.

DnvF2ns7O2bhD29x3MauJA.text: Great food but bad servers!! Customer service is key theres good food everywhere in vegas.

uTxxhSySNQ8LLCt-J3tyTw.text: Visited the old firefly joint about two days ago and I was very disappointed.  Lackluster place with no zest to it, place is always empty and it feels like there's only 5 tables in the whole place.  They need to improve the vibe for this joint, there is no appeal for customers to visit this place.  Salsas are stale, tacos are not good and they're expensive.   The only good thing is the beer selection which doesn't make out for the fact that you will get bad service and bad food.  Overall I would visit several other taco places before you go and take a look at this dump. There's a great variety of places in town that kill this place.  Avoid at all costs!!!!

eFLo8vCHOiEqzm2-1Shi7Q.text: From the under seasoned tacos to the bad service, this place has no redeeming factors except maybe the light fixtures(?). Honestly, don't waste your time or money on this garbage place. If you're looking for a good taco or a decent dining experience go to Tacos El Gordo or Taco y Taco.

0R3YuO7SCM6JpslUc4KD3w.text: Came to tacos and beer for the first time and I give it 3 stars because of customer service and the ambiance. The food was ok but it didn't meet my expectations.

V7CiAjxt1eZQC2KCyg98Ww.text: Tried this place out. Food was all pretty good. Tacos were a good size and all the ones I tried out had good flavor. The tortillas were so fresh and authentic, delicious! We all shared a margarita pitcher which was also good. Only thing was service was ok at best. But I think since grat was included, he really didn't worry about us that much. Sat at table for 10-15 minutes before being asked for drinks. The place was steady but not busy enough for that type of service. Would def come back and try them again.

9jxRSrzY4HyZbYUuXfZX0Q.text: I've been back three times but no longer sit at the bar. Every business meeting I have here, impresses my guests. Great beer selection and the tacos are excellent.   Service is great as is the food. But Ms attitude still rules at the bar.  I avoid her. Bad energy. Karma's a bitch.

BPAItPscgvZ0Jovfdeo_fw.text: If Ciara wasn't the best server I had all day... She was friendly, knowledgeable, engaging, and was quick to explain when things weren't going as expected. I'll come back to tacos and beer in a heartbeat knowing she works here.

rdnFUXkS80cnF0vxw4ZI7w.text: Absolutely awesome tacos!!! Go on a Tuesday night for their techno taco Tuesday night! They have an awesome techno tent with lasers and a great world class dj along with dollar taco specials. I highly recommend. A local favorite

mG5quifIJgLJAFhVuB42tg.text: This little corner of heaven is fantastic and the service was awesome. I like that they have a vast variety of spirits! My favorite taco was Cochinita Pibil Taco, which was a great recommendation from our server Ben. The enviroment is low key and relaxed and the food stands out on its own.

27lq8nUMrUBXoktV9QeiQQ.text: After being told there was a 30 minute wait and almost having to wait an hour our group was about to leave. We decided to stay because we had already waited a long time. After being seated the manager Manuel came out and apologized for the inconvenience and also brought out a pitcher of sangria and a pitcher of margarita on the house. The staff there was great and they turned the not so great start into an amazing dinner. The food was awesome and the dessert was also fantastic! I would recommend everyone try out their tacos they are delicious! Definitely will be going back again.

HHy5QR4MuKILOfsOOuaYEw.text: Food: Best Mexican in Vegas, no the best I've ever had. Excellent flavors.  Value: Slightly over priced but still worth it. Service: WAIT TIME WAS 2 hours from the moment I got there till the moment I got my food. I was told I had bad timing, a few big parties were ahead of me. The manager made it up by offering complimentary chips and salsa and free drinks for everyone in my party.  Atmosphere: Very hipster, classy little spot.

TzLg58JTtSmPIRRJ82oZfg.text: Great service, really nice staff and apparently the manager is somewhat new and WOW is he great especially his team!

0YNuSfLe30IgpwWLHUb87g.text: This is a very delicious taco establishment. Ari is the best hostest ever. I drove from Michigan to eat here.

Fd5s_kfxjtbvQ343mIGwMw.text: This place has been amazing both times I've gone. Once with three people and once with over ten. The service and food were both great for a great price. The bacon wrapped jalapenos were awesome, I got them both times. I also had the fundido, again amazing. As for tacos, I had carne asada both times, shrimp, crunchy chicken, and another chicken one with pickled slaw. Delicious. They also have a full bar... not just beer. :)

jKdCKcJU52vxezaVZvDEXg.text: Went back again and they messed up my order - twice.  Only giving it 3 stars since they gave me a $10 gift card as a courtesy, but I haven't been back yet.

yUrwiut2U3qxWZrzOufznw.text: This place is awesome. The atmosphere, the service and damn those tacos are delicious. The shrimp and battered fish tacos are to die for.  Frank was our server and he really was the best. Super friendly and helpful. Thanks Frank! Can't wait to go back.

3zhS7QDSf7bRP5X8_Cue8w.text: Bad costumer services, waiter did not introduced himself. Had the runner just drop of the waters without saying Hi. Not a friendly place, everyone look like they had a hangover. Will I come here again, NOPE.

hdjBL-hM9xlmEQK47xJdgg.text: Great taco selection, mind boggling craft beer selection. Nice people, friendly staff, casual and easy going. Happy hour 3-6 weekdays. Have 4 tacos and a beer for under $15. I'll go here dirty and scruffy after working all day. $15 later I'm done with dinner and heading to the hotel to clean up. eeeeew!

6SCvTKDv1rf9VOpQ_2edUw.text: I liked this place. Great taco's. Great selection of Beer. Good, quick service. Nice interior.  Good music posters on the wall (Sonic Youth, Sebadoh, Dinosaur Jr.) I'm gonna go again, next time in town.

7fNqOqX0tEENMSSDeNsdFA.text: Great food and atmosphere.  Our server Shellie was very attentive. She went out of her way to assist one of our party with a food allergy. Kudos!

phUGKP_4eO_Sz-acJLrI0g.text: This place place is delicious!! In order from best to good is Bacon wrapped Jalapenos (bomb) tacos Cochinita Pibil (bomb) Baja Tacos (good) and Chicken enchiladas in green sauce (very good). I will definitely come back when in town. I didn't think it would be this good...tbh. I underestimated.

2F9A95So7akR2CcCFVEsrg.text: Really good mix of options. Must have been over 22 types of tacos. Also had a great variety of beers to choose from. Would go again for sure.

4GdpgEirKemMbNH_dxxnug.text: If you're from out of town and want to get something more real than what is on the Strip, go here. It is fantastic! The serving staff is excellent. Our server, Armando, guided us in exactly the right direction. He advised our tacos (Puerco Verde, Baja, and Crunchy tacos) and my beer selections (two bourbon barrel aged ones) and my wife and I could not have been happier. We loved being in a normal restaurant (where locals go) with prepared food that had authentic taste. It was such a treat. We will be back whenever we are back in Vegas. #TacosandbeerOP #TACOTUESDAY #CraftBeer #VegasLocals #localspot

4rXkeLxGUb3gw81NaGt8kg.text: Best Gourmet Tacos I've ever had!! Cochinita and puerco verde with chicharron are two of my favorites! The atmosphere and decoration of the venue are very welcoming and not to mention every time we go they treat us like family, from the wait staff to management. If you're into craft beer they have some of the best selection in town and they're constantly rotating.

8H3EnMf32r98DhswBJxfTg.text: One of my favorite places to bring my friends.  Great food, great service...great atmosphere! It's so affordable and the portions are perfect. The cilantro-lime rice is a must have, if you like cilantro.  I always get a crunchy taco with my order.  On my most recent visit I opted for the beef barbacoa and a crunchy taco with ground beef. Hands down my new default/go-to item on the menu.  My goal is to try all of them!!

oTa8IAliRB0rvN9TGtfKow.text: This is a fave restaurant with great food and yummy mango margaritas! The food and service are always excellent even when popping in on Taco Tuesday! Our table ordered the Guacamole, Queso, Baja Fish Tacos, the Fried Avocado Taco, Crunchy Beef and Chicken Asada Tacos. Everything was delicious! Even though we were stuffed, we couldn't resist ordering the Choco Tacos for dessert. Yum!

A1OgqJwufxDwt3zkTlIbTA.text: I had 2 tocos and they were amazing. I just don't remember what I had because of the very good margaritas I had. If you are in that area it is a must go. Not good for kids. Get there before the party starts and you can get a seat. It gets crowded fast.

V5_88GWTQzF3Gv62Zwb1ug.text: I loved the chicken tacos. The shell was a fresh corn tortilla that was out of this world. Each taco was flavorful and fresh. I was there for the $5 margaritas and those were delicious as well. Service was great; food arrived fast and a great atmosphere to sit with friends to eat, drink and chat.

RNWk-en1flwMt92q_c3tow.text: One of my fave places to eat in Vegas! Best tacos in Vegas with many options. The margaritas are strong and delicious! The best thing is that they have a happy hour on Sunday that ends at 6! Every time that I go the service is amazing, Ethel is s True gem and  gave exceptional service.

PsE088VWf3RXarg7mzeAFA.text: Aayyyeeee!!! AMAZING ! Food/Drinks/Desert so on point! Had to come here twice during my visit. Definitely a place I will always come visit when I'm in Vegas! And i hope Frank serves us every time ! He's so funny and definitely tries to make sure we get everything we need! :) #ChorizoTacos

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nc8l1N_er4KMDraa6QEcfg.text: Personally we have been here before, the service was very unprofessional and took longer than other customers. We went today in hopes maybe it was just the server having a bad day. We ordered asada fries and four tacos. The asada fries were adequate with the cheese having a weird flavor and the tacos were average. The service was again the same, slow and inattentive. I added an extra star solely for the manager.

8Hx1XMEjoCdORo9iuKc9ow.text: I usually love this place. Atmosphere and food is great and reasonably priced. Only reason this isn't a perfect review is because the last time I was there I definitely got food poisoning  but like...I'll be back

ZUyoWyOX6V9-P5RFiuPOQw.text: Did an online search before coming to Vegas for taco places & this one came recommended. So glad we took the ride off the strip to come here! The tacos were AMAZING!! Had the avocado, chicken Asada & the cochinita...all were super yummy!! We also had the chips & queso, which was a different flavor and such a nice break from the norm! Will definitely come back here our next trip to Vegas.

2nav66azk1KA4rYPGQ7qag.text: Fantastic tacos , service and great waitress on a bust Saturday night. Very quick service

PIm_eJqagyZlIl29gugxnQ.text: The best local taco restaurant in town! I've celebrated my birthday here several times. Whether it's for lunch or for a special occasion i love this place

ceClJckX2j5aOKIFpBrlrA.text: Awesome bartenders!  So helpful with the craft beers. Very attentive. Would recommend this place with no hesitation.

3FQ32Dpnu5Qk1im-YiRefw.text: So i like nachos. My husband likes nachos. We rarely eat all of our nachos. This place's nachos we ate to the entirety. Great atmosphere. We sat at the bar. Ordered 2 rounds of drinks. I enjoyed a margarita and him a beer. Sever was nice and decent pricing.

tVDbsM3tf4slCY99Wu88bQ.text: Celebrated my sister's wedding here while visiting Las Vegas.  This was the BEST authentic Mexican food I have ever had!!!  We devoured 3 different types of tacos - beef, pork & chicken.  All were perfectly seasoned with yummy garnishes.  I am not typically a fan of refried beans, but these were an exception.  They were amazing.  The rice was flavored with cilantro (my favorite).  My sister's wedding cake was a huge churro cake.  The churros served to the guests were HOT and soft with raspberry/chocolate dipping sauce.  I have only had the hard chewy churros from warmers at theme parks.  Never again.  I don't know if I will ever find a place with such delicious churros near home.

D_1fhaOehRiPpvTWekNpwA.text: Poppin' place, probably because it was Saturday and its close to the strip and the place is nice. They have a huge taco selection, they are $3-$4+  for regular size tacos, staff is alright, expect to wait to get seated or to get your food when its packed. The tacos are not amazinglyyyyy good, I know they have specials during "Taco Tuesday" but it probably gets packed. If you are going on a date or birthday dinner and are craving tacos, this can be the place, other than that you can just go to the "usual" taco spots.

cUNuQt6NadkEnhiqUXyA8Q.text: Awesome place, with a very inviting atmosphere. Tacos has  a great selection of beer on tap. The bartender Jordan is amazing and super knowledgeable about Mezcal! The selection of food and taco menu are quite enjoyable. I would highly recommend stopping in. Definitely will be back.

dmW9MQ5TjD7WUBNAy3MQ3A.text: Came to Vegas for the first time 2 years ago and we heard about this place. On our 4 day business trip we ate dinner here 3 Times. Great selection of cocktails and beers. The draft selection is great with about 20 choices. Menu has some great choices of what you call "street tacos" made how you want it. Service is pretty quick and gets everything handled right away. The place is very clean and not too crazy. Good environment to have a business meeting and dinner. The guacamole is delish. So fresh and chunky. The margarita can be frozen or on the rocks. Good flavor choices. Tables are setup well and gives everyone ample room. Not too overcrowded. The place is located in a small strip mall and has plenty of parking outside. There is also outdoor seating but not with a great view.  I don't think you'll need a reservation but if you suspect the area to be busy, be safe and call ahead

3tpuIFb4hHXLlIihn_kdHw.text: Had so much fun here, drinks and food are amazing. Our bartender was Danni and she was so sweet and helpful! Will definitely be back especially if she's working!!

5hD9n6TtIDaMwEurF09Y7g.text: I'm not a fan, been here about 4 times, it's always a problem every time I'm come, food is mediocre, if it's not asking them to turn on the air in the Summertime because there's no ventilation, to the waiters not being attentive

LAKIXD9i-IF2n4hpyOXyCg.text: Amazing best Tacos, Best Service, Best ambiance.  It'd try the Cadillac Margarita and shrimp tacos! I come here all the time. My favorite night is Tecno Tuesday.

IWW9RRUAqalnHizaMgCzzg.text: This was just not that good to me. Great service but food was just okay. We had a variety of the tacos, rice and black beans, and some guacamole. I didn't like the chips. Skinny margarita was fine.

6zuPzAxVTz2sqNA2rDl9kw.text: Nothing to write home about. Mediocre tacos.. shrimp taco was the best of 6 different tacos. Server compared the hard shell tacos to Taco Bell. He wasn't wrong.   I do like the option of lettuce wrapping though.   Came for taco Tuesday. $.50 off tacos, but be careful to check your bill to see if it's applied.   Would eat here again, but wouldn't go out of my way.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken taco, Baja fish

ua9TJejc9ZU2KpdDO7-o6w.text: This place is so cool! It definitely lives up to its hype. The decor is noteworthy and surely a nice conversation piece. The tacos are dope with many options! Cool that they offer vegan and vegetarian options as well. Bathrooms were well stocked and clean as was the restaurant itself.  I always  appreciate well lit parking lots too. The only bummer was our server seemed a bit absent from our first time experience. This was a Monday dinner service with many open tables inside. I'll be back as the food quality exceeded that of the service, and look forward to doing so.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and salsa

uK_0LJtDnTYI1jqM-P4auw.text: OH MY GOODNESS. TACOS AND BEER. This place is a godsend. I have been disappointed by taco places all across the country but this place hit the spot and knocked it out of the park each and every way. The decor is metal, the customer service is solid. They have plenty of seating inside and out. Their menu is expansive. For a place that advertises tacos and beers, they still offer a few other options like quesadillas and burritos but as you'd imagine, they focus on tacos and they do it spectacularly. I tried the 8 tacos and honestly could have kept eating and eating and eating. I could eat through their whole menu and probably not be disappointed. They also have vegan and vegetarian ( and pescatarian options as well) if need be. Definitely worth a pit stop, you won't be disappointed!!!

bH8oCmRBaEdEsdvM2Y9EPg.text: Fabulous. I did not sample a single bite or sip that I regretted.  Rather, it was udder despair when it was finished.  Delish!!! The taco selection is not only creative, but so damn delicious.  I sampled my way through the taco and marg menu, without disappointment.  And, Victor, the Colombian bartender was not only adorable, but knowledgeable, friendly and a superb mixologist.  What MORE could you possibly ask for???  Don't miss this off-the-strip Vegas destination!!!

vjGrF7vFbeh7Mb3cMFh8bg.text: Had tacos with the freshest ingredients and amazing flavors.  Every part of the meal was so good and it was brought to us by Alberto.  He added to the great night we had.  I will be back often!  Hope they franchise to the east coast soon.  Ask Alberto which tequila to shoot with oranges and cinnamon.   Thank you Alberto you are the best.

llc85LURq9PNoBuNgBM5pQ.text: Craving Mexican food I knew that something had to be close especially with the wonderful array of choices here. The Envy Hotel that I am staying out recommend Ed this location, besides me already being aware of it. I have always wanted to try Tacos and Beer, so here I am. I know in my own experiences that tacos go especially well with beer. This establishment is no different, since their tacos are amazing. The style and feel of the restaurant is so laid back bar type cool. I am surprised that they don't have pool tables, this seems to be what they lack. One can dream of course. This is a sit down restaurant with very amazing murals and paintings surrounding the guest. The service is stellar. The music is upbeat and in English which is something I like since it is old school rock from the 90s and it takes me back to the old days.   The alcohol choices that they provide from the bar are exceptional. Their prices for example on mezcal vary from $11-40. So it is nice to see the various variations of alcohol choices from low to high; and the in between too. I ordered Coors Light since I wanted to taste how the beer would pair with their carne asada tacos. The soft tortilla shells on the tacos are larger than that of street tacos and they taste so good. These tacos melt in your mouth in essence and pair well with beer.  I am a real big fan of green chili's so as an appetizer I tried the green chili's with cheese and held the chili sauce. The chili sauce is hot but I feel that it ruins the cheese filled green chili's. Dessert was something that the twins wanted so I ordered them the dessert tacos. These dessert tacos are waffle style cones shaped like taco shells with chocolate on it and vanilla ice cream inside . On top of the ice cream is chocolate and Carmel sauce . These dessert tacos pair well with beer too. What a wonderful restaurant to come and eat great Mexican and have a moving experience with beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Tacos. Choco Tacos.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita

t2B-F8Oh--lJtyVbukcEsA.text: I love the concept and decor, but the last few times I went, the food hasn't seemed as fresh as it used to.  The corn salad, which we used to love, has been mushy and tasted like it had been in the fridge for a few days.  The carne asada tasted spoiled and gamey; I couldn't even finish the taco!  I hope this place gets it back together. It saddens me to have to drop my rating from five stars to three, but food freshness and quality counts.

6zeNgkZ5qMq0kSCqg9QQTw.text: Some good tacos, we tried the Barbacoa, shrimp and grilled fish tacos.  The barbacoa was good but not memorable. I enjoyed the shrimp and grilled fish tacos but wish it wasn't smothered by so much sauce, it was overpowering the all dish.   The host didn't seemed bothered about her job which is a shame as she is the first and last person to deal with customers. My take out order arrived and she was talking about her life to her colleague while I could watch my food sitting on the counter.  I just got up and checked that it was my order, she finally came to give me the bill and left.  Meh not impressive.

c87JRgNW5So3F_FvXWi64w.text: Had a great time and Victor the bartender was cool nice guy.. food is great.. 2nd time there and I have not been disappointed yet.. tacos are awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb ass drink

cePOwS1hDtkgx9ElNsLX2w.text: Every time we visit Las Vegas we HAVE to make time to go to Tacos & Beer!  The baja fish tacos are  a #1 item!

Fpn7svQjyX6vkbAvqERtYw.text: Eat here every time in Vegas.  Love the food. Moderate prices.  Crunchy Chicken Tacos are to die for

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco!

5ls8Dwbdls9tLW6sqIxeYw.text: 4.5 stars for this awesome place.   The ambiance is really something to enjoy. Lots of good energy and the wall art is not what you'd expect, so go check it out. I'm not going to spoil it for you.   Tacos and beer is what this place is all about, they do have burritos and other options, but why?!?!?  Eat the house specialty's and go home pleasantly surprised, full and ready to come back for more.   We came at lunch, easy to park but I was told go for dinner, live music and dancing?  Well, I'm going to find out next time. You should too.

Ng9LVH6ljiR1vLVl8nY8yA.text: The guacamole is really deelishious  the tacos were good but I prefer my tortillas like the street taco tortillas. The flavours were yummy and the portions are bigger than street tacos. Looks good for groups. Went during lunch hour on a weekday and it was busy but not too busy you wouldn't get a table. Service was great and the decor was nice. I would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar wall and nice light fixtures.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole, Chips and Salsa,Beef Barbacoa Taco, Lengua Taco and I cant remember the other three tacos.

w6TBJZnu5Kh5ASAYCplEoQ.text: Wow! What an absolute gem. Came here for a date night, had a wonderful experience from start to finish.  I ordered the classic margarita, strong & tasty  The bacon wrapped jalapenos are to DIE for. Apparently they're famous for them & I totally understand why.  I got the beer battered avocado, chicken asada & crunchy taco. All excellent.  The crunchy taco has mashed potatoes in it and although it sounds strange, it was phenomenal!  For dessert I tried the flaw, equally tasty.   This place has a nice atmosphere, great for dates. Wonderful service. Plenty of beer  10/10

G1VUmmEr-TSi_dS-71x1XA.text: I've been here several times and I enjoy it more and more each time I come in. There are infinite taco options in Las Vegas, this is probably one of my top 3 favorite places.  I'm still exploring the whole menu but I always get the shrimp taco. Most places will plop 3-4 whole shrimp in there but here, they slice up the shrimp so the taco is easier to bite, and it's sauteed w/guajillo chili, topped w/cilantro-lime slaw, pico, guac, and chili crema on a flour tortilla.  Service is always fast and the place is always busy but I've never had to wait for a table.  I'm not really into beer, but I discovered tonight that they have a whole craft cocktail menu and half of it is seasonal specialties!  It was hard to decide, but I settled on one called purple haze (pictured). Gin/lemon juice/lavender/ginger beer/mint leaves and a couple other things.  Very unique and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Haze

b3uUdpdtx9JTnfbkgnhITQ.text: Love Tacos & Beer!  Come to Vegas all the time for work, it's really nice to get off the strip and get some real food. Sat at the bar and Skyler too great care of our group. Excellent selection of beers and tacos, good selection of starters and other dishes.

Kkg3ydj_NDGXNj_bBMl33w.text: Lots of pescatarian and vegetarian friendly tacos that are super yummy! Always get seated quickly. Cool ambiance and a go to place every time I visit Vegas

-mZS-h4EL5uybkP7pWr_Jg.text: Lots of rave reviews on here so I had high hopes. The margarita pitcher was good. They filled it generously. I ordered shrimp tacos, carne Assad, and al pastor. All three tacos were dripping with oil and soggy from all of the liquid. The shrimp was so fishy I didn't eat more than a few bites. I ordered a chicken tinga...and that was extremely wet as well. My boyfriend ordered a dish from the back of the menu-like a ranchero huechaca or something and he did not enjoy the flavors at all.  Great decor though
