ZJAZVdvF6Sq63rLefEtsZg.text: Great tacos. Awesome bartender. Amazing place to go if you want a flavor packed meal with friendly service and festive atmosphere. Highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F14mqsYwaa9bfbvMxiwlZA.text: Hostesses were on point on sunday afternoon/night and got our party sat quickly. Server slayed it as well per usual. Would definitely recommend. (Usa vs mexico)

oFOxNsHlChNGe7dWalGUTg.text: Went here with my vegetarian girlfriends on our last trip to Vegas, BEST tacos in town no joke!! And the service is pro!!! We got helped by Lukas and he was amazing, all the staff was.  Go here next time! Cool menu for both vegetarian and non.

f8rcddsgk4jR7tOjfGBNBg.text: So the food was good... that's about all that was enjoyable about the place though. We sat outside and we're pretty much ignored for a majority of our stay. Ordered drinks from two different people, only to have to go open a bar tab myself just so I can get my drinks. Place came highly recommended and I had been blindly recommending it to others as well. Finally gave it a try and had a tip added to the bill and it went unmentioned, had empty drink glasses the whole dinner service, the server never returned after the food was brought out. Took my family here promising them a great time and was left embarrassed... and so I thought maybe it was a fluke so took my husband in last night well needless to say, but after last nights service, my recommendation will come with a warning of wait times and empty drink cups and missing servers.   It's a shame when a great spot with a stellar menu gets muddied up because they let service go by the wayside.

UviAar0Jn7dkk0bccY_wgQ.text: Went there with my friends from Peru and Lucas took care of us! He definitely knows how customer service works! He recommended us the carne asada tacos and the grilled fish. OMG those tacos are the best ones I have ever tried in my life. We got some margaritas to go with those and discovered the best combo ever! Thank you so much Lucas! Will be coming back soon with my friends and family!

QOXWiqDLrG5pXUNGfSQBoQ.text: Wow. Where do I even begin?   Aesthetic: 5 Star. Cool music, it's like a cool spin on Mexican   Service: 5 Star. They know their menu and make awesome recommendations for food and drink.   Food: 5 Star, highly recommend the "flutas" to start, we had like a sampler of half their tacos and all were amazing. The meat is soooo tender. The sauces they use wow. Wow wow. Fresh amazing. I have high expectation for a dining experience and they met everything.   HIGHLY recommend if u want chill atmosphere good tacos and drinks.

nXoeZ97Pe-V-rCBAHT3d5g.text: It was nice to see how many different tacos are offered on the menu, they even have a few options for vegetarian/vegan diets which isn't usually the case. I was very much a fan of the veggie empanada. Our tacos came out incredibly quick (I think before our margarita pitcher) which was the only thing I'd change was how long the pitcher took. Otherwise our waiter was friendly and knowledgable and I was a fan of the non-traditional Mexican restaurant decor. Reasonably priced. Nice draft beer selection too.

vSEIpNdRRSDpR_S8IDaHEg.text: If you like casual, laid back beer and tacos this is the place for you.  My wife over heard an airline employee say this was 1 of her favorite restaurants in the country.    Big words, but True if this is your scene.   The house Marg was a little sweet and the first vodka soda was a little flat, but each we're quickly fixed.

sLlGrZiC15jzy713LcBIUA.text: The food was amazing, the service was terrible. Showed up for lunch today, and were seated promptly. Server took drink order, but didn't offer any recommendations. Server drops off drinks, then rushes off without taking order. We wait and wait and wait.......no server. Other servers just walk back and forth past our table, no acknowledgement. There were about 4 tables at the time. I flag down a young man, who gets us a server, not the original one. The server seemed annoyed and rushed off to put in the order. The young man came back and told me that my original server went on break and didn't tell anyone we were waiting to order. Like it was hard for the other servers not on break to notice? Thank god the food was amazing. The cooks and chefs should quit and open up their own place, not do the servers any favors. While leaving, no one said goodbye. Male server and hostess stood at the front door talking about a boyfriend or something and didn't even acknowledge us leaving. I will never come back and never recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dFB9TrBjJ8Cal2Mrwgei6g.text: Had lunch here today and everything was on point, service and food!! Lily was very sweet, helpful and always smiling, food exceeded expectations, They have the most authentic tacos !!

GHapozTm6SWtSKGSI6lwlg.text: Best Mexican food ever . Great service and good prices. The Crunchy taco is the best . Since las year i'm visiting this place during my vacations at Vegas . Highly Recommended this place.

FCTZtvRA3I1lbWO-xnJDiA.text: Last night after a few drinks my fiancee and I were in need of some quick, cheap and delicious drunk food. At first we were thinking fast food but then we passed by tacos and beer and thought, why not! And we were not disappointed at all. We ordered guacamole and added corn, bacon and cities. It was absolutely delicious, had some hint of spice, lots of crumbled, crispy bacon and sweet corn. Our tacos came out shortly after. The prices were amazing, most expensive was shrimp at $3.95 and a lot were under $3. I got shrimp and carne asada, and they were the best tacos I have had in Las Vegas. They were big, over flowing with pico sauce, guac and meat. If you are a fan of shrimp tacos, you have to try the ones at tacos and beer. My fiancee got lengua, carnitas and beef barboca and each of his were better than the last. Each taco had an array of fillings and sauces and the flavored were perfect. We didn't try any drinks (had just come from a bar) but next time for sure.  The only downside is that it took a pretty long time for our waitress to come over and get our order, but the food quickly made up for that minor misstep on the waitress' end.   We will definitely be heading back to this place very soon and often.

LZFXKdOpSmgHAqDQJGy7ig.text: These are the best tacos I've had thus far in Vegas. Not to mention the incredible assortment of beers to go along with it. Justin was a great server and had excellent recommendations. Overall a great dining experience!

E3XlliMehy1so_-13w-pUg.text: Let's start by saying the food is pretty good and the bartenders are nice, but the hostesses are rude. I asked the hostess for a table and she asked me, "Did you already order at the bar?", and I respond yes. She told me that she couldn't give me a table because the server would get mad! I asked why and she said, "Because you've already ordered at the bar.".  I asked why this was a problem and she said that the servers lose money whenever you order at the bar. So apparently I'm not allowed to sit at a table because the server might not like it. The hostess noticed that I was getting upset and she said she would give me a table, but if she needed it to seat someone else I would have to take my food and move to the bar. I told her that's fine because at that time the restaurant was getting empty and a lot of tables were getting clear.  My server must have assumed I wasn't going to tip him because he brought me water and never returned to take my order. I ended up ordering food at the bar. I finished and tipped the bartender for being so helpful, and also my server even though he was useless. Maybe the managers need to watch their servers and hostesses more closely.

309aSu9FBzQqHqutWVP0NQ.text: All of the Tacos and Apps we have had here have been incredible. The place can get kinda crazy on Taco Tuesday and the tacos are a bit pricey compared to some other options in town but they really are worth it as a treat once in awhile. Good selection of Mexican Beers and liquors as well to compliment your tacos.

Jfdg5n1fIQW6KLvjhRTp8g.text: I love this place.  Wait staff very helpful and nice.  Beer selection was pretty good.  Being a warm day we elected to go with the Deschutes Fresh Squeezed w/ Grapefruit Juice (a.k.a shandy) per the waitress suggestion.  Hit the spot.  Tacos were really good as well.  All in all a pleasant experience.

KeGypbc3tpMh-3tRgR1sug.text: Good tacos and great service.  If you wanna get off the strip and enjoy some chill atmosphere and some good food check it out.

yf_D9iP65I-V-Axr_YMkjQ.text: Don't go here!!!! This is the worst place I've been to in a very long time and it really really takes a lot for me to say that but I feel everyone needs to know so that they don't experience what I had to go through. From the beginning I knew it was a bad sign when my party and I were not greeted , not knowing if we can seat ourselves or have to wait for someone, after waiting for a minute to be seated we were told to sit anywhere and when we chose a table we were told "you can't sit there". What!!? So after we were given a table that we could sit at our waiter came by and took our order, well that was the only time we saw our waiter, he disappeared never to return, never checked up on us, NOTHING! Our order was wrong when it was brought to us and our side dishes didn't come until the end, the point of side dishes are to enjoy them during the meal. The food was nothing special and nothing out of the ordinary, their beans taste exactly like Hormel chilli beans and everything lacked flavor. Del taco has better tacos and beans than this place and they even sell burgers! With no service from our waiter I flagged down the busboy and then took the job of our waiter refilling our drinks and taking our plates, etc. When it came time to pay the bill it was just as awful, more like a 25min awful wait. I literally could've dined and dashed with all the opportunities I was given not being served but my party said no because karma is a bitch so I agreed. I ended up getting up to pay the bill at the front of the Resturant where I met the owner and told him about our horrible experience and he didn't seem to care, at the same time out waiter magically appeared as we were leaving and talking to his boss. After a couple of minutes of them talking our waiter came back with a revised bill, I paid him and gave the tip to our busboy. On top of all the horrible service and horrible food I ended up getting food poisoning that I still am suffering from as I write this review. DONT GO HERE! Save your money, there are way better places with better food than this place.

XTni7Vufrd-SQPGWfxVvsA.text: We ate here while traveling.  I had purchased a Groupon and we got a huge amount of food: yummy guacamole with chips, 6 tacos, 2 sides, and we ordered beer from the happy hour menu. We ordered the tacos our waitress recommended and they were really good: fish, crunchy, and pork with 2 sides: rice and corn salad.  We loved it all.  The food came quickly.  We'd eat here again and especially would come during happy hour.

WUqw-4dyWQfSeUsCwHfI_Q.text: First let me say that I am not a beer drinker, but my brother and friends are. The tacos are outstanding with a very authentic taste. My personal favorite is the Pork Taco Al Pastor and the Chicken Tinga Taco. The chips and salsa are some of my favorite in town. The wait staff and bartenders are pretty awesome and I have never had a bad time here. I highly recommend it to friends and family, and visit there about once a week these days. I've been for lunch, dinner and for drinks late. There's never a bad time to stop in. The beer is great, and I usually ask for a sample of the ones I don't know. They are always generous with the samples and usually recommend a good beer based on my tastes. I end up with something on the light side like a Maui Blonde, but my brother likes the Sucaba and darker beers from Firestone. The prices are very reasonable, unlike Aces and Ales which is similar but very pricey. Give it a try, I don't think you will be disappointed.

Pzq5FRnSDBfo3nAdh5pKoQ.text: I wanted to check this place out being that there has been such rave reviews.  I will say that the idea of the ambiance that was created was very inviting and  had somewhat of an authentic feel to it. Once we were greeted and seated, we started to notice that there was quite a bit of disorder and chaos near and around the kitchen area.  The waitress took longer than most places to take our order. Once we received our food, which was mediocre to say the least, it felt as though employees were hovering over us.  We felt very rushed and uncomfortable.  I looked around and noticed that they were doing that with all the tables.  Just a word of advice, if you are looking to enjoy a meal at your pace without helicopter employees, I would not recommend Imperial Tacos & Beer.  I honestly think that with the proper training in this industry to bring it up to standards, this place could have potential.  At this point, I will not be returning.

56I0amdqKZquxemEJ5R00A.text: Fantastic food, cheap as hell and awesome ambience. DEFINITELY coming back!! Got the fish taco (mouthful of tender fish and limey awesomeness) and the beef barbacoa taco (not a better way to my heart than putting mashed potatoes in my taco). A++

FRlyw6UPHpTVHs8c483Yug.text: Unimpressive to say the least. My wife and I came here for a late lunch and found everything underwhelming. The service was slow, chips and salsa was generic store bought stuff, the ceviche was all lime and came with stale tostadas. And to top it off the tacos were bland and kind of cold. The only positives were the busser who was on top of his tasks and a solid beer selection. Would not recommend and will not be back.

l-mucM_1B2mPTnBI38_8lw.text: Don't waste your time.  Food is just ok and the service may be the worst in the city!  A friend and I went for an early dinner, around 6 pm.  The place was hardly half full.  We waited for quite some time before we were even greeted.  Then the greeting consisted of, "do you want to start with margaritas?" When we declined the drinks, the server left and a different server came back 10 mins later to take our food order.   We started with chips and guac which were mediocre, a little bland.  So we thought we add some spice.  We asked for hot sauce and continued asking for it, 3 times to be exact, didn't get it till our tacos came out.  I don't know if maybe they were having an off day but will definitely not be back to waste my money.     I am a very understand customer especially being that I work in that industry but man, it was honestly that bad!

P-COHo1l0sTIUBmAru8R4Q.text: Let me start off by saying I am a huge taco fan!  So when I tell you that the tacos here are some of the best tacos I've ever had, that really means something. I've been here multiple times and tried almost all the tacos so far, my favorites are the al pastor and the veggie. The al pastor is so flavorful with little chunks of pineapple on top... And you might think I'm crazy when I say the veggie taco is one of my favorites, most people like meat in their tacos, but this veggie taco is so tasty! Mashed potato in place of meat, mushrooms and what ever else veggies it has, perfect... It might just turn me vegetarian! Jk but it is very good. I'm not a beer fan at all, so I can't comment on the beers, but the cocktails I've had are the Dirty South Andy (kinda like a Moscow mule with little tweaks) and House Margarita (it has "salt air" instead of salted rim which is pretty unique and cool!). This place is pretty new still but I think once the word gets around it will be pretty popular!

LTUJeJjkeXYQDflSzGWGrA.text: I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. We came in and ordered 6 different tacos in order to get an appropriate idea of the restaurants flavor. Shrimp taco was fishy. Pork was flavorless. Beef taco actually had a piece of melted plastic. A joke. The manager was amazing and actually comped our whole meal but I still am giving one star because the food was not even worth that.

YWYedwbBn-tGSDJVBXZ0KA.text: Ordered six tacos to go and it took 30 minutes. Got the tacos and they were cold. I took them back and the bartender was rude and argumentative. She said they would remake them and I said I didn't have any more time to wait. She asked for a receipt which she didn't give in the first place. The restaurant wasn't even busy. This was my second time here, it's unlikely that I'll go back.

8HbJi3xP9FxMxh8SGjt8Rg.text: On my way to jersey mike's decided to stop and check it out. I decided to order 3 tacos to go and my friend order 2 tacos...it took 30 minutes to get my 3 tacos. The hostess was very apologetic but i figured they would offer me some chips and salsa or even a soft drink while we waited. Prices are pretty high for an off the strip taco place.  $12 for 3 tacos.  The Al Pastor taco was good. The Chicken tinga was bland with not much flavor.

e7_LqfPxO7Q2WYTL1sJLsQ.text: Absolutely amazing!  Great guacamole,  great salsa, great corn salad, fresh and awesome!

XGCVDNJg1QL92v-ZUcLy6w.text: Great tacos (I recommend the 'crunchy') very nice beer selection. I was surprised and pleased...from the plain jane name was expecting a dive bar.

Q7PYQzUa4yP_pXTpqAJc2w.text: Seriously the best tacos I've ever had! They had great happy hour specials on during the time we went and totally took advantage. $5 margaritas and a variety of tacos for $3 each. The atmosphere and service was superb.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour tacos...I tried one of each. The pulled pork was my fave.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour tacos...$3 each

u5vFos1dQuq_qTjP8S7fJA.text: I made reservations two weeks ago for my girlfriends birthday  for 12 of us at 2pm. We were seated quickly upon our arrival but that was about the end of our speedy service.   Our server started off by taking our drink order. We all ordered waters and some ordered beer. I ordered a Purple Haze Drink and a friend ordered the Jamaica Con Mezcal, both of which were too strong and too sweet. We both had everyone at the table try ours and not a single person liked either of them. They were gross and at $12.00 a piece, I didn't want to take a chance on anything else.   About 20 minutes later, we were ready to order some appetizers, but our server was no where to be found. When we all finally were able to order the chips and salsa or chips and guac, they all came out at different times. It was confusing, some of us were sure if he got our order or not. Eventually everything came out and we snacked on that for a while. The green salsa was delicious and the other needed salt, it really had no flavor.   I was over the drink I ordered and decided to order a glass of champagne. I had two kids with us that ordered drinks and all three of us were forgotten about. My glass came with a shot of bourbon, that I didn't order and sent back, which ended up on the bill later.  A half hour of waiting later, our table started to get restless and wanted to order food. It was extremely difficult to get our servers attention. I don't know if they were busy or if he was the only person that can take orders but it was frustrating for the entire group.  We eventually all ordered our food and in about ten minutes, everything started to come out sporadically. I ordered 1 chorizo taco, 1 al pastor taco and 1 shrimp taco. While I appreciated the homemade tortillas, they were soaked from the sauces put on the taco and they fell apart in our hands. That was a unanimous comment from everyone at the table as well as the flavor of the tacos "just weren't that great." I also ordered a side of the cilantro lime slaw.......it was a pinch of slaw with some sauce poured on top. It was laughable and seemed more like an afterthought and not worth the $2.00 that they charge for a side.   A friend ordered the tortilla soup and she said it was just alright and tasted different than every other tortilla soup shes had. My son ordered a plain bean and cheese burrito that came with Spanish rice that had NO flavor at all.  My father in law ordered the vegan avocado taco, I was  going to order one after my first three and he told me not to bother, it wasn't that great. However, the bacon wrapped jalapenos were a hit, we had at least three orders of those.   We sat there once we were done eating waiting for the check to come, it didn't. We all tried to get our servers attention, we couldn't. Eventually,  two people got his attention and our server had the check on him and left it at the table. I did let him know when we first sat down that it was my girlfriends birthday and he brought the birthday flan when picking up the bill money.  This restaurant charges 20% gratuity for a party over 6 and they also do not let you split the bill. Everyone brought cash and that was fine. What is NOT fine is the mandatory tip. I am not cheap in any way and will give large tips as well as track down the manager to let them know what a great job a server did. Being forced to pay 20% of this bill for the service that we got is a little messed up. Not a single person at our tale was happy and no one wanted to leave anything more than the mandatory tip.   I do not recommend this restaurant.

Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Purple haze deconstructed
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Women&#39;s bathroom

I9Si82BgCJBwLOTaUCmoIg.text: So we had a event at UNLV that night and we were having one of those taco cravings. We had driven by this place a few times recently and kept saying those famous "next time were here" phrases, well we decided to pull the trigger and were not disappointed, here is our take on things...  Food - In one word, awesome!!!!!. First there were so many different tacos to choose from but we ended up with me having chicken and my wife having steak and carnitas. The tortillas were homemade, the meat was flavored well, juicy an tender. We did a side of guacamole and chips and will say the guacamole was pretty good. The dessert is what put this place over the top, churros with some trimmings were amazing (DO NOT LEAVE WITHOUT GETTING THE CHURROS).   Atmosphere - There is both inside and outside dining, the inside is intimate so may want to make reservations on open table or, better yet YELP. The inside was decorated really well and had a unique feel. The bar can only be described as bad ass, reminded me of this old school place i visited in Mexico once.   Staff - The wait staff was very attentive, do not think my drink was every empty. Our waiter was very calm and relaxed, thou there were people waiting we didn't feel rushed at all. The waiter was even able to help us create a meal for a finicky 6 year old.  To my locals, if you have not tried this place, put it on your radar. Thou close to the strip, the place felt like a chill place away from the hustle and bustle of a weekend on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2fme8ao5_CoUvinFERSvvQ.text: Get your Taco fix!  WoW this place is great. The atmosphere is perfect and the food is outstanding! Service was friendly, fast and fresh. The tortillas are hand pressed and cooked to order.  I don't give up five stars often.   Imperial Taco & Beer serving up just what you would expect, Taco's Taco's Taco's !  Find 20 beers on tap and another 50 bottled varieties as well as 10 versions of tacos such as shrimp, veggie, pork al pastor and carne asada. Jicama salad, tamales, enchiladas and ceviche are just some of the other dishes that make the menu. Most items on the menu are less than $10.  The restaurant serves lunch daily from 11:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. and dinner from 5 p.m. to 2 a.m. daily.  Note the parking lot is small, tight and packed with a lot of other businesses.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SMa-vjtGtHeowbjIPlkZdQ.text: Considering I don't like tacos and/or beer on the regular, I am very shocked that I liked this place lol   A friend of mines decided on this place to celebrate his birthday because of their vegetarian options. And tbh, when I saw the menu, I was immediately drawn to their vegetarian options as well.  I think I always find taco/meat somewhat salty so, I already knew I wanted to try their avocado and pineapple taco! And I have to tell you, I still think about their avocado tacos. I just loved the fried Avo and the texture.   And their churros **drool** very very very good. Crunchy on the outside and soft to the bite. It's how they should always be! Then they have chocolate and frosting dipping sauce on the side **DED** the chocolate dip was my fave!  Considering it was a Friday and my party of 20 with 4 kids was available was great for our family of friends! There was more than enough room for us and the kids even ran around the table after dinner.   Just note that with large groups, they don't offer split checks. So we all had to bring cash!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado and pineapple tacos. 143 avocado tacos!!!!!!!
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12 hours later. STILL THINKING ABOUT THESE CHURROS!

X-Rd3wQ0q0wOeweMr6IMMg.text: Food 5 stars Service 2.5 stars  We had friends visiting and brought them here where they cater to vegans and non vegans. The food was fantastic!! Everything from drinks to apps to dinner, the flavors of mexico were flowing and we couldn't get enough of it. Their vegan options are amazing and my carnivore friends loved their meat meals so this place caters to everyone.  Regarding the service, she was very slow. It took about 10 minutes before being greeted and the service just lacked the whole time with her. She was friendly but def affected the schedule we were on.  She even dropped off our check without asking if we were done but we went ahead and closed it. We weren't quite done with drinks and informed her we wanted another round of drinks when closing out the food tab. She dropped off our paid check and we asked her to plz take our drink order bc she was slow and before her new table of 7 ordered but she didn't. She took their order 1st, punched it into the computer and then attempted to hand us another tables check, still no drink order was given.   Also the bar service was very slow as well  This place is delicious and worth checking out. I just hope service improves bc it this doesn't encourage us to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their 3 vegan tacos. All delicious

M6eJWsXWgnHoXth3Nz89uA.text: I go to tacos & beer often.  I usually get the Veggie Taco or the Rajas con cream.  Both are great. I am drinking margaritas as I write this review so this review is not going to be as eloquent as I would like it to be.  The music is standard boring 00's post punk hipster crap.      Today we requested that the bar change the T.V. to the Spurs' game, so for that I'm giving them the 4 star review.  Always good service, never superior tacos but definitely always solid.   The tortillas are super fresh & are made by the hands of a beautiful older Mexican woman.    Happy Hour was cool today.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour 3-6 pm !

wvk7rKRMxn-JageCn-wtFg.text: I've been here a few times and generally, my experiences have been mediocre but the last time I went there was generally awful.   We were celebrating my wife's birthday and had a large party. We sat outside. It was a Tuesday so there were good specials on drinks and tacos. We had around 8-10 people at our table and probably another 8-10 at another table. Ordering was almost impossible. We asked people repeatedly to please take our order and they all responded with a version of "we will go get your server." This got so bad that a couple of our friends eventually left and ate somewhere else because they couldn't order food.  Beyond the brutal service, the way the check was given to us was ridiculous. The server dropped our check and a couple of people in our party had left and we began to try and figure it out. It was around $400 and I was trying to figure out who ordered what. This is a normal problem for eating and a large group and often times someone ends up paying a bit more but we were looking at paying $200 of the check and couldn't figure out why. When finally went to pay the check, I had to go track down our server and he said, "oops someone paid for there portion and the bill is actually $250." So then I had to go back and give people money back in our group who had chipped in more because our server didn't tell us that people that left had paid.   I realize that service to large parties is difficult and stressful but just neglecting us was pretty terrible. On top of this, paying a 20% auto-grat made it feel like they didn't care about or table because they were going to charge gratuity anyways.  I probably won't go here again even though the food is pretty good. The service was just too bad.

M7yw6rMK-_EtLWKt1snXAw.text: This has to be a Vegas staple. 1. The decor inside is beautiful especially the bar. 2. The corn tortillas are from scratch and are filling 3. The meat is quality. They do have huge TVs.  My only negative is that the place is small! I had this same complaint in my undergrad when it was Fire Fly's. Somethings never change. They can accommedate 2-3 large groups 6-10 inside. They also have patio seating. Great for a date night spot. They also have happy hour from 3-6pm. If you don't mind being cramped in there on a busy day and you love music on then go on Taco Tuesdays. This could be a favorite spot for locals and contender with Pink Taco. The drinks aren't strong either or maybe it's what I order, the blended margaritas. I'll be going back tomorrow so maybe I'll try something new.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First dinning area near entry - huge tv behind me.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up Carnitas Taco
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carintas Tacos - custom

7_0JGp8oiZ2Z2Q_Qp7j_mA.text: Tacos & Beer tonight after work. No Beer for this gentleman, but I love me some tacos  Didn't realize I'd hit the late night happy hour & they have 4 tacos for only 2.50 each. I was recommended the chicken tinga from a hot chica and I also got the barbacoa taco. Both were very flavorful, but the winner is the tinga. Not necessarily my kind of tacos, but they were delicious.

lZ4pZdlmVJDWfR_7rIbNhA.text: This place was a short walk away from the hotel my boyfriend and I stayed in and he already picked it out by the time we landed in Vegas.   My first thought was that the tacos were decently priced at about 3.50 or 3.75 for one and some special ones going over that 4 mark, such as the shrimp taco. I got 3 and so did my boyfriend. We both got the chicken potato one, I got a shrimp one, he got some other ones that I don't remember. They were great! So much good content inside. The sauce for each one was delicious and was just so good. We spent the rest of the trip comparing the tacos here with tacos elsewhere and this one won by a long shot.  I would've given it a 5 but the waitress we had was a little.. blunt and just didn't seem to have much emotion at all. Didn't really feel hospitable. Other than the service, great atmosphere, great food.

RDEP5XWUiY7cN9cTNZGbPg.text: In every side of town, there is a place where locals call their "spots." It's a place where they can wind down after work, take friends when they are in town, meet up with dates, or just come in on a Sunday and get blacked out. Tacos & Beer is my local spot. The staff is absolutely fantastic, Manuel not only knows the industry people, he knows how to make them feel special and always stop by if he is around. Tacos & Beer is 10.10 on my local dining list. =)

WkmWY_EppY8b92MCz5exmw.text: Tacos! Beer! What's not to love!? I have yet to have a bad experience here at Tacos & Beer. The food always comes out quickly and tastes fresh. I also love that you can peer into the kitchen area and witness tortillas being made fresh.  Their happy hour food offerings are a bit underwhelming, but the drinks are a great deal! I opted for the Cadillac margarita and it was pleasant. I wish it contained a tad bit more tequila, but that's honestly just who I am as a person.  Pescatarians (like myself) are sure to enjoy the array of meatless options. They even have a vegan jackfruit taco. I personally prefer the rajas con crema taco. I usually pair it with the shrimp taco and fried avocado taco. The latter is a bit spotty, sometimes it's very good, other times it's a bit questionable (the shrimp taco and rajas con crema taco have never let me down).  We finished off the meal with an order of choco tacos. They're always perfect. The waffle cone/taco shell hybrid is a piece of art. Surprisingly, they're not very messy--when eaten with care.  Altogether, I'm a fan of Tacos & Beer. I wish the prices were a bit more reasonable so I could go here more often. The ambiance is on point and the staff is always super friendly. Our server this evening was Lily, she was incredibly attentive and sweet! Her service made a great meal even better.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Choco Taco!
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Death Vader wall art.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cadillac Margarita.

D5yvGRqbYYA96e5kUp9QXA.text: I would give it 5 stars but had terrible waitress who didn't come to our table to refill our drinks. We wanted to order more food, but she took so long coming back that we changed our minds. We were visiting Las Vegas from Austin and yelped tacos.   They were absolutely delicious and authentic. Everything we ordered was perfectly seasoned and cooked. Everything! Delicious food and drinks.  So delicious that we ate here 2 days in a row, but unfortunately we got the same waitress both times!

tbl_mpg30vvOCpxTW6p65Q.text: I loved this spot. They had a great selection of beers and surprised me with a very quality list of tequila.The food and service were outstanding. Melissa took care of us at the bar. Mike the manager was beyond friendly and went above and beyond. If you want some tasty Mexican come here. The tacos we ordered were great as well as the corn salad. Next time I am in town I will be back.

ELnzq2z_Nvu0nWMgblpB2A.text: taco tuesday, wednesday, thursday, and all the days   good atmosphere, tasty bites & solid cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso Fundido
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El Grande Platter
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mzCTPgtrOgU2v6JnUP4fiQ.text: Picked up my family at the airport and wanted to find a Mexican restaurant near the airport so we went here. I made reservations which I suggest anywhere if possible on a Sat. Night anywhere in Las Vegas. It was a cool funky decor and nice atmosphere overall. I got the 3 tacos. Carne asada and shrimp. They were small to average size street type tacos and tasted good. The margaritas however were very small and they weren't even filled up-when you're paying $10-$14 per margarita you expect the glass to be filled or looked like it was missing 2 inches of drink so that was disappointing. It was ok but def not a lot of alcohol Tho so if you want strong margs they weren't it. But  the food was pretty tasty and besides our waitress forgetting my guests sour cream and he waited and we asked numerous people 3x...which was frustrating-it was a decent experience. However when a customer specifically says NO Crumbled Mexican cheese and sour cream on the side-don't bring no sour cream and put crumbed cheese all over the meal. That was a bit frustrating. If those issues didn't occur I would have given a higher score. Having to pay for chips and salsa is usually a deal breaker bc we always eat lots of chips & salsa. You have to pay @$2.99 and you only get small amounts of salsa and small bowl of chips-thankfully the busboy brought us more chips. Overall it was a lace I may return to in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My guest tried the peanut butter stout beer -he said it was pretty tasty
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside decor
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool lighting decor inside

8XJ3qbzsR-2QJ5v95dUh2Q.text: Good food, cute venue and of course, beer. Because I failed to plan, we didn't have any reservation for dinner on a Friday night... The first wait across the street was 1+ hour so we tried our luck at Tacos and Beer. Originally we were quoted a 40 minute wait. They took my name and phone number while we headed across the way for drinks while we waited (bar was full.) I got a text about 15 minutes later saying our table was ready! They pushed tables together and got us seated as quickly as possible which I really appreciated.   I got the veggie taco, pineapple black bean taco and avocado-potato taco. That's ranked in order of my favorites and oh my gossshhhh they are so good! And vegan too. Plus, they're only about $4 but they are small. We got a few pitchers of margaritas to share for about $35 per pitcher and some basic cocktails. The only downside was that we couldn't split the check at all but that's their standard for big parties.   Overall, I'm grateful they were able to snag us a table of twelve so quickly- it really set a good tone for the rest of the night. I've been here often for food but the pineapple black bean taco was a new menu item and it should absolutely be in your next order whether you're vegan or not. Thank you Tacos and Beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3Df3dHZCnjxn2ur9yBMXHw.text: I thought the food was good! I had the food yelped to our hotel. Ordered tacos de lengua and cilantro rice. The tacos were good but they didn't have any cilantro, onions or salsa. It could have been a mix up. But the meat was good and tasty. I will dream about that cilantro rice though!!! It was soooooooo good I can't express that enough.

lSTEAMUka1JsJOq5Tf0T3g.text: Fun place to be social. Great selection of beers.  Fast service and tacos are okay for a chain restaurant.

92ZeHpusD1YixkyTa4IGDg.text: Great food, beer and service. Unique tacos all over the place! Convenient to the restaurant district east of the strip.

vPwVY-PHczkA8JCRJ7UeLw.text: Hello Yelpers,   A friend and I went here on our lunch break and I have to say I'm a fan. The only reason I gave it 4 starts instead of 5 is because it is a bit pricey for how much you get.  That being said, the food was awesome! The vibe is cool. And the service is good... Bartender, waitresses were all very nice.

4aJbflQGPdgWi4Sa8xkGOQ.text: Hate to give lack luster reviews but ya. Something is wrong in taco town.   We went on a tuesday. Had to wait a little bit for a table not to long. Lil disappointing the hotesses did not have control of the wait list and was not doing anything about large parties sitting at dirty tables & seating themselves ( huge turn off to fellow f&b ) We had a small wait and needed a 3 seater so its trivial. We get seated grab some appetizers. Salsas where good. Chips where gross though. I dont know if they are house made? Cold, bland and hard. Ive had better chips from the grocery. Tacos where just ok. We each ordered 2 each Beef, pork , fish and chicken. Was not impressed in an understatement. Size and portion was nice , dressed nice. Flavor bland and dare I say old. We had leftovers a rarity with these guys. I went to eat them the next day and just felt they where gross, eneded up tossing it.  Servers are nice , host was nice , bar was nice. Beer menu chalk board and numbers to order are awesome and worked well for us. We loved almost all the beers. The fruit beer no one enjoyed but hey you didnt brew the beer.  Techno tuesday was fun. A techno tent with lights & some music outside. We enjoyed the photo booth and the couple selling natural wraps outside.  Idk thought maybe they where just having an off night. Seems more like via the other reviews they are having a hard time with quality control.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn salad, heavy on the peppers. Im ok with that. Wished they served hot more like an elote
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salsa good, tacos meh, empanadas we liked.

Ol_gwkM5YMx2s_vZpzsauA.text: When first arriving we were seated sooner than expected. Paid for chips and got plenty more in refills, because it took forever to get are food. Salsa was good (4/5). Yet charged extra for the salsa for the chips. Drinks were warm, little ice. Food was ok, tacos were nothing special. Flavors were over the top a bit excessive at times. Atmosphere was fun and vibrant. Out of everything Rudy, (are waiter) was excellent  despite the disappointing aspects.  Sincerely: The True Review

JDjrRk1iv6_JpB_ReCPNPA.text: Started off thinking it was going to be a one star meal as the ginger hostess tried to cram us in the corner with tables surrounding it full of people when half of the restaurant was empty made no sense I confronted her she rolled her eyes and move us to another table .  Our server was Alyssa (I fell in love immediately )thought she did a great job my friend didn't like her shrimp nachos but I thought my tacos were pretty damn good

rIdPS2WrlnCeDRa0D9FfEA.text: Outstanding Food, Beer and Service here! Great Tacos, Cerviche, Fish and Shrimp Tacos..

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

esdWiVdz3WbTGLeV1-3ZdA.text: Recommend by a friend who is local in LV. The beer selection is outstanding, and the bartender, Maria, was awesome (I had just left work and was ready for lunch). Fantastic food, great service!! Some amazing art on the walls, too; grab a drink and check this place out!

Q-buWD4B_el4qWjl1sJuSQ.text: Favorite taco spot.   The music, the GUACAMOLE! The quality of tacos and the many different tacos that you get to choose from makes it all worth while.  On Tuesday's of course you will get a louder crowd but it is still fun and the atmosphere is lively, who doesn't love that when going out for Tacos y beer?  We have brought many friends and family here and always recommend it to everyone who asks for a good spot because it is simply the best. Good vibe, good food, no complaints!  My favorite tacos are: Carne Asada, Chorizo, Baja fish, El Pastor

JjPt3JW46Pic1q1yp_wIRw.text: Party of three, all of whom would have been giving two thumbs up if they weren't so busy snarfing down delicious tacos. And chips and salsa. And margaritas and beer.  I wasn't entirely surprised by the quality of the food given the Yelp reviews, but I didn't expect the dining area to be so warm and inviting. I loved the decor, particularly some of the artwork (the donkey and the girl!). We will definitely be back.  In the meantime, I want to thank the chef/owner for taking part in the KNPR auction. I came here because I'd bid on, and won, a $40 dining certificate. I'll be back because I loved your food. Thank you for supporting our much-needed local PR station!

xVCjANIAD7eDzeW_2nAEbw.text: One of my favorite places in all of Las Vegas. Not only is all of their food amazing, but the atmosphere is great as well. Located off of the Strip in a random strip mall, this place is definitely a local's spot. They have an amazing late night happy hour with tons of food and drink specials. Some of my favorite tacos are the al pastor and fish. The tacos are decently sized and come with handmade tortillas. However, the best part about this place is Techno Taco Tuesday. On Tuesday nights not only does this place have a happy hour, but they bring an entire party to their restaurant. They have great local DJs tear it up on the patio outside. I know it's hard to believe that you can find a great party at a Mexican restaurant, but trust me you should totally check it out. Can't wait to rage again at Techno Taco Tuesday!

LAVaUljQfQJcCNjrrH-EaA.text: I love this place, especially their carnitas tacos with chicarrones. It's a decadent bite of pork goodness and at $3.75 each the price is right. When I'm burned out on The Strip, I hit Tacos and Beer for, well, tacos & beer without pretense.

ZlqVSOfK1mdycgZwbTRwxQ.text: Just want to say again.  This place is great!  So many tacos to choose from!  The sides menu has a couple hidden gems.  The beer selection is very good.  The tequila choices are good as well.  The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.   It's a great regular joint when in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zku5QppjQkE_ASFf2AV-KQ.text: This place is great from the ambiance to the taste of the food/ beer selection. I wanted to give 4 stars because they used to have these amazing street tacos that they took off the menu and have no interest in bringing back (best thing on the menu and super popular so WHY!?!?!!) but I guess that wouldn't be fair. I'm assuming it's because they weren't as expensive as their gourmet tacos (their main menu) but were way more popular so they were probably losing money. I would come here again anyway though because everything else is great. Just wish they'd considered bringing those tacos back!!

ikfa6WFgn14AqhNCrqamWA.text: Tacos and Beer was such a pleasant surprise. We ended up there by accident. We did not think much of it until we got inside. What an original and great atmosphere!!! Our waiter Frank was amazing. Not only was he super attentive but he had so much charisma and professionalism.  Will definitively return on my next trip to vegas.

_qPH4bHR6Eu4M3gIuePy5g.text: Now this is a worthy destination and should be a must do next time you are in Vegas. So many tasty options...  I had a Chorizo, Baja Fish, Chicken Tiki or something-or-other and a beef tongue.... All awesome!!!  The Margaritas were great too!  And it was taco Tuesday so 50 off each taco. So good  Do it!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try one of each.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tongue. So tender.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A True religious experience

mSMOBPiiJjfAIUpM358ahw.text: Who doesn't love perfect tacos at 1am? These guys have a great happy hour and a cool atmosphere to catch up with friends in. Not very busy on the late night tip, but that makes it even more perfect for those "we're hungry and don't want to spend a billion dollars on food" nights near the strip.  My friend and I ordered the chicken tinga and barbacoa tacos, both of which where amazing. A real plus is that they are regular size tacos. No street minis here, so 2 filled me up quite nicely. Got some guac too, and it was perfect. Passion fruit margaritas hit the spot to wash it all down.  Service was great, even at closing time (2am). As a night owl who loves late dining, I highly recommend Tacos & Beer.

UDLasdsm21YvTUFYyEMtOA.text: The quality of this establishment has gone down over the last few months. The food is still good, but the quality isn't consistent. Service has become poor. I used to be a fan of T&B and lately it's been a real let down.

hZZ6NXCvRksHARQbh0dmYQ.text: Tacos and Beer is a cool lil joint with great food and a great tacos.  The decor is hipster mixed with traditional mexican art.  From the wooden Cheech and Chong art carving over the bar to the prayer candles dangling upside down from the ceiling.  The tacos are like traditional street tacos on steriods with a gourmet twist.  They even make their own tortillas fresh in the back. They have a great teauila and mezcal selection and delicious craft cocktails.  Stop on in!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaica Mezcal and Pepino cocktails
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer battered Baja fish, Al Pastor and beer battered avocado tacos
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome wood art of Cheech and Chong over the bar

F5rTy_5CcMpT_gJXEIz-YA.text: I absolutely love this place. The raspberry margaritas are EVERYTHING, and the queso and shrimp tacos are UH-MAY-ZING! It's a great place to go for a quick date, or with friends to laugh the night away. Be aware though that on Tuesday's large parties are limited to 1.5 hours as it's a pretty busy night!

T-SwDlc127cHZRmYAQMVtg.text: Small to medium size restaurant. Was recommended by our server from our happy hour at the hotel. Nice little family ambience. Prices were ok. Food was very good. Chips and salsa were good and plenty of Taco creations to choose from. I had the Beef Barbados and the Stuffed Crunchy Chicken tacos. Bar on the premises. Margaritas on Special on Mondays. Didn't like they charged extra for salsa on the chip refill without saying anything, but it was good. Server was friendly and service was good. Would go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HWcR_4MW-xRgqu52meRS7g.text: Great selection of tacos and even better service! Frank is very friendly and attentive. Definitely a must try in the area!

3fqH9ETPVCW7gRAPlPMEBQ.text: Great food and churros are on point! I recommend  carna Asada taco  restaurant is sociable and has a great atmosphere to enjoy yourself  and your company.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco Tuesday, great Dj lancelerok &amp; tino.

KUYqafGG1-1aCMZoHWltqg.text: Cool hidden spot. Great food. Service was on point and very friendly. At night they have a cool music vibe.

VwjSfcsDN2jhuOPhn2S4kQ.text: Excellent and unusual beer selection.  Mostly not beers I've seen elsewhere.  The tacos are superlative and reasonably priced.  Ambiance is good.  They have outside seating with misters. Service was good,  too.  Love this place.

ueowsv-CBdNgurirBNdLpA.text: 1. Awesome veggie tacos 2. Awesome rajas tacos 3. Hanna provides fantastic service  I'm on my third day in a row at this place.

dEMDiJEIQQsQ24rZMZfZvQ.text: Really good tacos at a price you can't beat. I love the Rajas Con Crema, roasted poblano, mushrooms, onion, corn with oaxaca cheese and poblano cream. I love the corn and cole slaw sides. Great service. Put it on your list to try. Good beer selection too.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zCsTjC270xhRK7n9zv6svQ.text: Techno Taco Tuesday is awesome. Fifty cents off all Tacos! The music is a great addition to the awesome taco selection they offer for customers. Drinks are strong and well-made, and the tacos are exquisitely put together.   The only reason why I'm putting 4 stars and not 5 is because I feel kind of rushed outta here...they cleared items from our table so fast even though I was still picking at some of the items.   Other than that, I'll be back for sure!

pEP9HPinBLJK-5-A9TIoPw.text: The food was fine, think chevy's quality, but I wouldn't eat here again nor would I recommend it, so two stars.   -Guacamole: large portion, was brought to our table ice cold; either avocados were in the freezer, or guac was made in the morning & refridgerated. Taste was decent, but I couldn't tell til it thawed.  -Chicken taqutos: again crazy portion sizes; fat, thick rolled tacos. Ends were crisp the way it's supposed to be, middle was soggy.  - Tacos: disn't take more than a bite of each. Fish taco tasted like a frozen fish stick, & was kind of fishy. Crispy taco w/ shredded beef was just huge & salty & greasy.   Obviously, quantity over quality is the name of the game here.   Waitress was overwhelming. We were one of three parties there before noon & she annoyingly showered us with attention, asking every 5 minutes, "and how are things tasting?" I was polite & didn't tell her.   I'm seeing a pattern with vegas eateries: as long as a restaurant doesn't completely suck, they're bestowed a near-perfect four-star rating. That rating system doesn't work for me.

NcJOg989gtTDFgUpsUJWaw.text: Cute and cozy restaurant in what used to be The original Firefly. Inside is lushly decorated and not your traditional obnoxious Mexican style. I went there on a Thursday and it was not very busy. We were eager to sit outside as the weather was just perfect, not a breathtaking view but sometimes it's just nice to sit outside. The server took a while to get to us and server seemed a little bit rushed. We ordered guacamole as an appetizer. It was pretty good, not sure if the chips were made in house or bought. I ordered the margarita and the server kindly let me know they use "foam salt" I had never tried it prior to coming here and I was feeling a little bit adventurous so I decided to opt into it. It was more foam than salt flavor but it didn't really change the margarita, next time I would order just the plain salt grain.  I had one carne asada taco and one lengua (beef tongue taco). The tortilla was definitely one of the best I've had in town, other than that, the carne asada was too salty and it did not come with limes. The lengua was pretty good.   Overall I wasn't particularly a fan of the service but the food was decent. They do have an extensive beer menu and taco selection which I was impressed with.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fbm9Ez3uo7FBwzHaysBt1A.text: Really friendly staff and great atmosphere. Would make a great place for a casual date. Prices are good. And the food is amazing! I got the steak, al pastor, shrimp and fish tacos. They also have a good beer selection on tap.

CRFCJJ5tx5gwPKBAE-DUrg.text: Many tacos have perished from this place at my hands. Was their death in vein? I don't really care just.... MORE TACOS PLEASE!!!!!!!  Oh yeah and the service is good. They serve the most delicious tacos.

O-9TJcvPaSvL_eqGWz6zaA.text: So I was very excited to try this new place out, menu looked good. When we got there we were seated right away, our waiter was very rude and short with us, I asked him for another drink menu and he said no we have no more in the restaurant. Really horrible service....... He ignored us the whole time the guy cleaning the table was a lot nicer ...

Pxzezu0sBztRJkWU0CdKCQ.text: Very yummy! I'd recommend the tacos they were sooo good, Especially the Al Pastor! Also recommend the bbq beef.  Entrees were not as impressive.  Nachos aren't as loaded and flavorful as you would want for $9. The steak had spot on flavor but it was a bit chewy.  It's nice to get off the strip in Vegas and find normal spots to eat and hang out.    This place has great drinks and decor even though its located in a strip mall it doesn't feel like you are just in a strip mall.  Great spot to hang out and stuff some margaritas & tacos in your system.

XXLXXpc3MYZhA1_j82Pkhg.text: Love the variety of tacos! From the meat to the fish and veggie tacos, all tasted really fresh & had just the right amount of toppings. Honestly can say I've found my Holy Grail Churros!!!! Cajeta filled Churros, with a side of chocolate sauce, need I say more? Nice selection of beers on tap. Asked for a cold glass & Alberto didn't hesitate to pour my beer perfectly! Great service & awesome food!!

6Jjc7hZTJPQ4nkMRpDSWcg.text: My gal pal and I tried this place out for the first time today and I was blown away. Their lengua is tender, delicious and so flavorful! Best lengua I've ever had. The atmosphere is fun and inviting, music is great! And the service is amazing! Mandy was our server and she did such a great job. She was very informative and super attentive. She definitely added to our already wonderful experience. I will definitely come back here!

niD-Y7KtYIBfbRfgK7k_Zg.text: "Eh". That sums it up. The beer was good but the restaurant didn't have much to do with that.  The food is way overpriced.  Didn't hate it. Wouldn't go back.

ZKO4_O_bFCBNSrWAyobG7g.text: Great micheladas and shots!  Good ambience, good crowd the tacos were decent.  More trendy, than actually great or worth coming back too.

7GuKZfOQuellDp8wRI9kig.text: Frank was the best and gave us some pretty great suggestions. That was my second time eating there and I will be back again!! Their margaritas are perfect and not sickly sweet like some places. All of the vegetarian tacos are flavorful and filling.

E_zbO34dZXhzBWYpLaDn5A.text: Thank you so much to Hank for inviting us back!! Food was fabulous but even better was the service from the time we walked in till the time we walked out! Kaley was excellent & earned herself some new regulars!! Definitely stepped their game up! Thank you Jaime, Hank & Kaley! We'll be back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Flan

AgVMdiUKtHbcNrKT-HzxUA.text: What a cool place to enjoy a few drinks and tacos on a night you just need to unwind and relax. I saw Melissa Y. check in here and I've always passed it while driving on Paradise so I thought hey why not give them a try. I can certainly say this is a young hipster-y vive of a Mexican joint. Can't exactly say the ambiance nor the food is your Abuela's authentic Mexican cooking, but a bit more Americanized and modern. I ordered the Baja fish taco, veggie taco with chips and salsa on the side. I enjoyed both tacos they were both pretty stuffed. The guac was a bit more "whipped" than I prefer, but once again this a modern fix on the tacos. This was all I ordered and it came out to $9 and some change. I was pretty full, so I did get my money's worth. I didn't order any drinks, but plan on doing so the next time I come. I sat at the bar and the bartender was okay for the most part but was just kind of whatever. I can't wait to come back here with friends to enjoy our selves.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian and fish taco

wWDb8l4X6gza4HVPrS-yzw.text: Great food and great service. When we arrived the patio was closed. They opened it for us, and I cant remember having a more pleasant evening in recent memory. The tacos were good, the margaritas better, but getting the attentive service is what makes going out to a place like this worthwhile. Special shouts out to Oscar, a most gracious and welcoming staff member.

7CNfAXyCy97KlL0aGQZETw.text: Words cannot begin to explain how great the tacos here are! This is my go to place for tacos and a great time. The atmosphere is lovely and the food is amazing! The waiters and waitresses make each experience wonderful as well. My waiter, Frank, was awesome! His customer service was superb. He checked on my coworker and I frequently and gave us excellent recommendations! Each Taco he suggested was so so good!! We will definitely be visiting again, hopefully he will be our waiter in the near future! :)

XCDybW2Wr1cpwKiZynJ4ZQ.text: Great place for a quick bite!   Traditional Margarita was good and the tacos are the way to go.   Think of this as a taco bar with a huge selection of beer.   Great place to go hill after a long day of work or a long night of partays!

z78pRLWj-axNesUl3LLL7A.text: We craved Mexican food and wanted to try something off the strip. Glad we found this place and just our luck it was during their happy hour. Our group of four shared a margarita pitcher, chips and guac, and tacos.  There is a charge ($2.95) for chips and salsa but I have to confess it is worth it. Both salsas were delicious!  our server was great, fun personality and was able to manage all tables with ease. We will definitely remember to come back when we visit Las Vegas again and recommend to friends who go.

dT4cepDkrcgBAKFHbT0pOQ.text: Tacos are very good and inexpensive. Can always order more when you eat what you ordered after you realize how good they were. Variety of beer with a variety of prices. Cute place. Friendly employees. Always seem to be ample parking. Great place to take visitors. Can even order food to go then run in and pick it up. Just check the bag before you leave because I had issues on the only two orders I did this way, so just double check. Will continue to go back because I like the food.

kEFnjm2qKBVQfvhG2G4sEw.text: I come here 2 or 3 times a week always great service  great food best gourmet tacos in town great selection beer

5dM1BCXKpIE9RyzXIWjbbg.text: quick service, awesome decor and atmosphere , food is fantastic and you don't wait long even when the place is really busy. I recommend chicken enchilada w/green sauce

hgQHy2naLtvAvnOrgV8UBg.text: One of the best taco places in town! Crunchy chicken is one of the best Ive ever had. Juicy chicken, good sauce, and mashed potatoes! Barboca was also delicious, but the shrimp one was just ok. My friends say the lengua and other chicken tacos were also good. Lots of tacos to choose from as well as other items. HH only includes 4 basic tacos and is better for drinks, but taco tuesdays is .50 off all tacos. The passionfruit margarita was super strong, but yummy. Would give 5 stars but server took a long time to take our order after serving our drinks and on the check the HH prices didnt show. When we asked he said "again?" Not sure if it was only that day and not to be cynical but I think they dont check before giving it or fix it unless you say something. Besides that he and the bussers were very friendly. Food also comes out fast.

D2oyfJ4ICGiN_GZecGJlSA.text: Great tacos, amazingly fresh guacamole, and an excellent atmosphere. I have been here in Vegas for six months and I cannot say I have had a better taco.

CnziRHQGegBkm-rAYoyrYQ.text: While waiting for our flight home to CA we were in need of somewhere to eat.. we drove around for a while and we discovered Taco's & Beer! We knew we had to go- the name says it all! We were quickly seated and began looking at the menu and we realized we found a great place! The tacos all sounded amazing!  Ruy was our server and he was great! Very friendly and informative. Our favorites were the Taco Baja, Al Pastor, and the Puerco Verde.  If we ever find ourselves in Las Vegas again we will definitely be back!

p7qG71lmt8xu1glSBMWwWw.text: Great taco selections, decent vegetarian options, and very good service. Recommended for taco lovers.

tJoZlMGa3fz10Ef5ejCCoQ.text: i would just like to thank this place for existing. excellent selection of rare bottled beers, the tacos are killer, and the atmosphere is great. will definitely be back whenever we're in vegas.

YAWK9nZPfc-VCh0tLujIGQ.text: Seriously good tacos!  Athena offed excellent service.  She is Very familiar with the menu and offered great recommendations. They make their corn tortillas in house.  Located in a Strip mall on Paradise.  Restrooms clean.  Just happened by...don't miss out.

CTmxG34RkI655bSJUo0TSw.text: The customer service is hands down ridiculous. Not in a bad way. I was having a great time enjoying my chips and awesome guac. My tacos supposedly to there standards took to long so they didn't charge me, which I thought was crazy since I didn't even mumble anything but compliments. The lady next to me did have some issues, entire meal paid for no questions asked. People always question how greatness is achieved, take note. Awesome food and customer service.

ErKcFQQVwRsSHN0Z_dQFaA.text: Drove into Vegas and friend was desperate for Queso after a long day of hiking at Zion National Park. After driving to several places that didn't seem ideal, we found Tacos & Beer on our way to the hotel. They have a great beer selection. Our waiter was very helpful. Cheese dip was average. Ordered a few of their tacos- the beer battered avocado Taco had no taste but the Carnitas taco was very good. Overall, great service, good beer selection, average food.

yOaijQh_qkvALxIlcjnFdA.text: I loved this place! The service was incredible and the tacos were delicious!  The manager, Armando, was friendly and treated our large group (10 people) with amazing hospitality. On top of that, our server Alan did a great job handling multiple bills all while staying on top of our needs. Overall great experience, I'll definitely be coming back!

yihJhYeeCKkw1_pLpBHylA.text: Tacos are amazing with incredible flavor combinations. Chips & Salsa are very fresh. Lots of flavor without too much heat. Overall great value at a great price point!

UidNeElLFRGi27AXLA3DaA.text: What fabulous customer service. I order from this restaurant all the time and last night I got my order from UberEATS and my chips were missing  I called and spoke with the manager, a really sweet girl, who not only apologized but gave me free churros! OPTL9RDwFMa9w9HZ3c6t6A.text: Hubby and I weren't too hungry and just looking for a quick bite. And then read the menu and got hungry. Everything we had was yummy. Can't wait to go back. Items like salsa and guacamole are homemade. Even the tortilla shells are homemade.  Without thinking I actually licked my plate. Yep it was that good. The only reason this is getting a 4 instead 5 was that we asked for "guacamole with chips". The waiter up charged $2 for the added salsa. We did not ask for this and being new to the establishment didn't recognize it as "extras when placed in front of us. We now know for next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole

KDvJK1hwatUZPU9nwPZTFg.text: My flight got canceled due to the surprise snow storm of March 2017, but it meant that I could stay an extra day and catch the legendary Techno Taco Tuesday. I'm so glad I could.  As a beer fiend, I was definitely excited about the draft beer menu. There's something here for everyone, and they feature a lot of very good beers per style. I didn't check out the bottles list, but I did see it was large and likely also nicely curated.  Wait for a table at 10 was an hour, but we got a seat after about 40 minutes. It was very hard to pick tacos since they all sounded so good. My favorites were the baja fish and al pastor. The quantity for the price was pretty good, I ca think, at least compared to some other taco places I've visited while in Vegas.  The TTT event itself was a lot of fun ($5 cover). I was impressed by the line up, and really dug the DJs, especially the dark techno. The headliner, Hito, got on at 1am, and she vitalized the packed crowd. Generally, other patrons were courteous and not too pushy, though some people commanded a large space for their dancing. Nonetheless, it was a memorable night and a great spot to dance with locals. The vibe is truly "come as you are" and mostly in their 20s.  Definitely check out this spot for the techno scene and some delicious drinks and eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hito getting on after Bad Beat
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Packed!

ZtHFc1ZMa_y2_-_qaojuOg.text: Great food and a great experience! I highly recommend the al pastor tacos. The lights went out during our meal but the service was still outstanding. The manager comped the meal because the lights had not been restored. Although the lights went out, the staff and manager refilled the chips basket multiple times and asked if they could refill our waters. I will definitely dine here again because of how professional the staff were during an electrical outage.

0ui93p-PXS6DNMFO-YXrhQ.text: Met here for my brother in laws birthday. I missed happy hour  but  prices were still reasonable I tried 3 tacos to start with. One bbq beef, one crunchy and a shrimp taco. Flavoring was on point but  my food came out cold. I also asked for no potatoes in my crunchy taco because i'm allergic. Food finally arrived and I bit into it and my mouth instantly began to tingle I had them take the tacos back for new ones and they still came back cold ( this time with no potatoes). So I coughed the rest of the time waiting for my throat to clear up. I also ordered clinatro  lime rice it was good and flavorful but also cold. We set next to the front window it's small inside not much to look at but I'd recommend this place

Qh3zWDmIkE3Ps2w0A9NoBw.text: I really like the design of the restaurant, very rustic and industrial, along with the twinkle lights. A great ambience always seems to make the food more enjoyable. I had the chicken enchiladas. They were delicious!   There are only 2 things to watch out for:   1) If you want great service and the food to be at its full potential, be smart by trying to go at less busier times. That's a rule of thumb for any restaurant anywhere.   2) It's a shame, I wish this restaurant was in a better location. Outside of the restaurant (in the parking lot), there are a lot of homeless people walking up to you asking for money day and night. I wish the city could do better by providing them with simple necessities  they need to get off the streets. Every time I've been to Tacos and Beer, they walk up to my friends and I. It never fails. And they're aggressive, almost harassing you for money. The thing is, not a lot of people carry cash now a days. And although I wish the homeless well, I don't trust anyone. (Especially when I'm a female walking fast and alone in the parking lot at night, trying to meet my friend in the restaurant.) You never know what somebody's True intentions are, whether they're homeless or not. I'm not being judgmental, I'm being honest.   So, if you feel unsafe, try walking in and out with a friend. It's such a great restaurant. Like I said, I wish it was in a better location.

9rGLW3JWlOGYmfEs6yqP6w.text: Always a great time dining here! The customer service is 10Stars! Everyone is so friendly and polite.   I had the beer battered fish taco and my friend had the grilled fish tacos. Both were exceptional.  Love all the salsa's and especially the habanero salsa, super hot, but so delicious   Highly recommend   On Paradise at Hughes Center

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iroBRgLi8yR0wy0DX9W9Cg.text: Order: Queso Modela & 3 Tacos (Beer Battered Avocado, Grilled Pineapple and Black Beans, & Pastor) Price: $20 Positives: Good tacos with some unique options (fried avocado, jackfruit, grilled pineapple), crazy good queso, lots of beer if that's your thing, very good outdoor seating Negatives: The tacos didn't really jump out as amazing, just good tldr: Taco's and beer seems like a great place to hang out with friends, drink some beer, crush some queso and eat good tacos. The key here, I think, is the hanging out with friends and beer part; while the queso was definitely amazing the tacos weren't the best we had in Vegas.  Thoughts: Stop number five on the eat and drink all the things tour in Vegas. It was fairly late at night, at least for us, as we had spent the evening visiting some friends at their house. We decided we wanted something to eat, but nothing crazy heavy, and really wanted it to be a quick in and out.   Since I think it's impossible to eat too many tacos we decided to go get tacos for the second time on our first full day in Vegas. Tacos and Beer wasn't far away so we decided to swing in and give them a shot, especially since they were still open. It's definitely more of a restaurant then your standard taco shop and there were a lot of people there drinking and hanging out. Make sense because you know, beer is in the name. We sat down in their cool outdoor seating area and quickly perused the menu. We settled on sharing three tacos and their Queso Modelo after some opinions from our server.  It didn't take long for the food to come out and we dug in. The tacos were all very good, but if I'm being honest the place we went earlier in the day was noticeably better. The fried avocado was good but was just fried avocado, the pastor was good but not quite as flavorful and juicy as some of my favorite taco places, the only real exception was the pineapple taco. The pineapple taco was made with small chunks of pineapple that were grilled and then tossed into the taco almost like chunks of meat. I don't know that it would be a favorite taco of mine, but it was very delicious and was a sweet, cool, refreshing taco versus the standard tacos filled with meat.  The real winner here was the Queso Modelo! Imagine your standard queso but with a special sauce and ground beef added in! It was killer. Absolutely something I would come back to Tacos and Bear for. It actually got me wondering whether the thing to get here Is there appetizers instead of their entrees. Regardless it was a pretty good choice for a late night. And it might be something I come back to if I was in the area. I think there are better tacos around but still overall a really good place. And it's worth pointing out that they staff was very friendly and very helpful, and you could get in and out pretty quickly. Overall a good place to grab some tacos and queso.

GmxhF1zllDR-Io9rsHf8Bg.text: Delicious food & great service everytime! I seem to always come here right before the kitchen closes. The 1st time I called before the kitchen closed they let me order my food so it would be ready when I arrive & could eat there after a long day of work. They were happy to take the order while I was driving & once we arrived our food was sitting hot & fresh out of the kitchen.  Luckily the rest of the place is still open so we were able to order drinks as well. I did this another time also when I needed to take my food to go then changed my mind & ate in & they had no problems with it. They have been very flexible!  Regarding the food, it's always been delicious although I have only been here for tacos & drinks.  They have a good happy hour menu & the main reason I love coming here is they have a good amount of vegetarian & seafood tacos. A taco could probably be eaten in 3-4 bites since they are the smaller street tacos but they are very flavorful! Fun decor as well. Definitely worth a trip!

SphdHUhqElelE0TUt_KJBA.text: Looking to avoid some of the pricing madness from the strip but also have quality food? Check this spot out, especially if you like craft beer.   Pros -best beer selection in town that I found during my trip hands down. They offer full pours and flights  -Awesome home made salsas the green and chipotle were both outstanding, I couldn't stop eating.  -Tacos were all amazing - honestly some of the best I've ever had. I went with the crunchy chicken, pollo Assad and fish taco - all were outstanding.   -Easy parking in the lot and about a $5 cab from the strip  -Prices were super average not $7 per taco like you'd find on the strip  -Massive selection of tequilas   Cons -Guac was made the day before and wish it had a bit more heat   Overall, I highly highly highly recommend this spot whether you are a beer lover or just like awesome tacos.

lY14U8UUDyq1VIMuduAZ5g.text: Tacos and Beer is a good place to get tacos and beer. Also margaritas. The margaritas are on tap! How fucking cool is that, and they're actually really good. The tacos are small but cheap so you can get a few for not a lot.   Basically you can get a lot of tacos and not have to pay out your ass. If only the drinks were priced a little better. The margaritas are about $10, which isn't unusual. It's just small for what you pay. They could maybe make it stronger. It's not that bad because the tacos are cheap. The tacos are something like $3 each. The flight of tacos is about $10, so you can get a variety. It has several vegan flavors. The avocado is the best of these.   Overall the tacos have good taste. It has a few specials. Of course they have Taco Tuesdays.
