m5K0CpSRDNJt9SA35_uGBg.text: Killer tacos.  Quite possibly the best carne asada tacos I've ever had.  Great beer selection.  Friendly, helpful staff.  Techno on Tuesday nights.  Need I say more?    Now I'm hungry for tacos...

LceIrjU5-3ubNos9dXA9bQ.text: Tried some new things on my latest visit that should definitely be on your radar: 1. Guacamole - of course 2. Queso - probably made with some beer in it and it had beans which was a yummy surprise 3. Tortilla soup - this thing blew me away. It was full of delicious-ness 4. Churros - I'm still dreaming about these things. 5. Flan - I am not a fan of flan, but I could see why all 15 people at our table were going nuts over this stuff. It is better than the rest.

nMdSuwiApd90_Vfw3zrmLA.text: My wife and I were looking for a place to eat off of the strip, and found this place on Yelp. We arrived during happy hour, which was perfect for us.  The chips were good, and the salsa was very tasty. Their tacos were delicious, and the tortillas are freshly made. It was nice to have an affordable meal for once.  Great ambiance, great music, great service.

Ax8z1JAHU-idocvY2SQWiA.text: Absolutely delicious! :) My friend and I got off of work and were looking for a new place to have a few drinks. I saw the Tacos and Beer sign and the appeal was instant.   The place itself has a great ambiance. Very welcoming and bartender was friendly. The food was great. I had to order more.. I had the beef adobado and the green pork. I also had the beer batter fish. Yum!!!  Margarita was delicious! I love the salt foam with tajin. that adds a great kick to it. Nachos were not all that great though.  The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is due to the Happy Hour menu was extremely limited. There is a great selection of beer and hoped there would be more options on the HH menu. Just four taco options. I had to order off the HH menu to get a variety of tacos. Also the bartenders were friendly but the rest of the staff was not welcoming at all. Sitting near the service bar, all I heard were the servers taking bad about their tables. I thought that was a bit unprofessional.   Regardless, I would absolutely recommend it to my friends!

mCEV8UUi8RVGRwf3ervcHA.text: I love this place! Our server Frank was the best! Great service. Every time I come to Vegas I HAVE to stop here! The food is so good. The best gourmet tacos in the country! Come here!! I also love the ambiance. On Tuesday's they have discounts.

phCFGqw1RnF3lMymSM7Eag.text: Giving three stars because it's a local spot that has great wait staff, a good vibe and good selection of beer and cocktails. Food is meh but I like that you can order to fit your appetite. Started with salsa and chips. Do not order this. Bagged chips from the supermarket with "fresh" salsa that tasted like ketchup. Also had the crunchy chicken, carne asada, and barbacoa Tacos. The carne asada was the best, really good. The barbacoa had some sort of BBQ sauce on it, like Hunt's brand. Not good. Crunchy chicken taco was just ok, nothing special. There are a wide variety of tacos on the menu, this was my experience with three. If you want a good local spot that doesn't have the tourist crowd from the strip, give this place a try.

MW_71q-BY00XQJiS9rUyfQ.text: Great Food!  Tacos were amazing and the service was excellent. Alberto did a great job! I will be back.

gWNsbYx4aDEGN4bi3OOjww.text: So I bring my girlfriend here quite often and her and I love it. Alberto was the best server I've had there. Check this place out. Happy hour is the best for margaritas.

mU_odxSQrY3oBCf-hQHCIw.text: I'd give more than five stars if I could! The service is perfect even during busy happy hour. The food awesome and drinks good price for the value. This is my third visit and the quality and flavor of the food is the same each time...great! Attentive staff. Armando and Alan are the best! Will continue to be a patron.

P71o7v62Q7I2ySUnueFszw.text: Great stuff. Will definitely be going back next time I am in Vegas. Tacos and Beer were great for me and the wife liked the margaritas. Extensive tap list.

C1-pBvv3M_GGJpx1dGcdIQ.text: This is decent food and a good selection of beer and liquors. I am not a huge fan of the tacos (a little to much going on even with a simple taco, sauces, seasonings) and I don't like the nickel and dime you mentality. It is weird that they charge $2 or something for chips and salsa. Then all the tacos have prices around $2-$3. The point is to sit there with some chips and salsa, scope the menu and drink your first drink. Instead you order, order again, wait and then order again. Seems drawn out. The entire menu is this way as well, which I don't care for. If you want something it costs less than $3 most of the time but two people, two drinks, tacos and 2 appetizers was $50 pre tip, and i wasn't exactly full. I think the format works with their other restaurant (Fire Fly) serving tapas, but with tacos it feels odd with tapas tacos.

O9fjHlqdwKei25LDJa53dg.text: This Establishment was highly recommended from my relative as I trust him with cool places to check out off of the Vegas strip. Well he was right on the money for Tacos & Beer. Greeted at the entrance with a friendly smile and seated quickly on a Thursday night. Our waiter was very friendly and provided excellent service all the way through our stay. Since Im a vegetarian, I was worried about my options but the veggie taco just blew me away with the delicious flavors that I ended ordering 2 more tacos.. We also had the chips and salsa which was just as good as we added some of the salsa to our tacos just to kick it up a notch.. The ambiance is perfect for my flavor, very chill with low lighting,, cool background music and nice modern mexican-latin decor.. Tacos & Beer in now a standard for me to stop by when Im in town as I will be checking out the Techno Tuesdays/ house music on Sundays..  Stop in for some chill eats, drinks, and beats...

uIPW8fgRyjRyFwHQKKY5fQ.text: Great food. HOWEVER, They have THE WORST SERVICE I have ever experienced. I made a reservation. We had to wave multiple servers down to order drinks and food. It's ridiculous. Whoever one of our servers was looked so irritated with us when we ordered. Just be warned. But the food and drinks are on point...but I prefer service over food.

T_EfQ7yLgoQQfxABVXEy7w.text: This place is fabulous. The tacos are really good and the beers are even better. I even once tried a pretty awesome jalapeno margarita but honestly I would rather drink the beer. Great atmosphere, great patio, always fun.

C0Uc-35hJdmKzaElcSQYyg.text: AMAZING & AUTHENTIC! The vibe in here is so great, and the handmade tortillas are unreal. Rachel is an awesome, down to earth and helpful server. Definitely coming back to Tacos & Beer next time we're in Vegas.

erArRoDvHnXmyCci6Mo45w.text: Enchiladas and mimosas. Burritos and bloody Mary's. Tostadas and Martinis. These are all Mexican food and alcohol combinations that you're not going to be eating here, because when a place is called tacos and beer then you better order some tacos and beer. Capiche? Now when I hear tacos and beer, I was expecting a tiny little place with 3 types of tacos and some cervezas. I walk into this place and was immediately taco slapped in the nostrils with some sweet sweet smells. Me and my crew had tacos going up..on a Tuesday and these tacos so good, we ain't choosy. These tacos here are well made you can tell they pay attention to detail. My two favorites were the chicken tinga and the al pastor. I also got to try the shrimp, the fish and carne Asada. All sorts of delicious and I can honestly say this was the first time I've had mashed potatoes in a burrito, so I tip my sombrero to you.  As you, my astute reader, have noticed, I haven't mentioned the beer part of tacos and beer. Worry not, because they hold it down. I expected a few beers, but this place had a whole book for beers, I only got to down a few IPAs and some tequila shots, because when life hands you lemons, pretend they're limes and do tequila shots. If you're a beer nerd then come right on down They have a few other menu items like tamales and enchiladas, and they offer margaritas. I didn't get to try them and I'm not bothered because if you come to a place named tacos and beer then you damn well better order some tacos and beer

kIag5pCzrXu-YaMJtfWchg.text: I got the wrong beer three times in two visits, but I'm still giving the place 5 stars. That's how much I liked it. Everything: the food, the beer (when I got the right one, and even sometimes when I didn't), the ambience, and the waitstaff.  I was in town for a trade show and in search of good tacos and beer. What luck to find Tacos + Beer just a mile away!  Let's start with the food. I'm from Florida and lived in New Mexico for four years, so I've had my share of good Mexican food. This is very, very good Mexican food. You can get individual tacos ($2.50-$4 ea.), enchiladas, tortas, nachos, etc. There are about 12-16 taco varieties to choose from, and over my two visits I tried pretty much all of them. My favorites were the Baja (fried) fish and the Rajas con Crema (roasted chiles + oaxaca cheese), but they were all phenomenal. The tortillas are fresh-made on site (you can watch it being done) and the ingredients all tasted very, very fresh. If you're a cilantro hater like myself, they'll happily remove it when possible. I also had a bit of someone else's torta and it was very tasty if slightly soggy due to the filling they chose.)  Then there's the beer. Las Vegas is a s**t town for beer. Everyone knows this. But this place has a beer selection to rival some of my favorite places in Boston, which is really saying something. There are 20 taps and they offer a really surprising mix of local, faraway domestic, and international beers. In my first visit, for instance, I had a Tilquin Gueuze, a Tahoe Mountain wild ale, and a Ballast Point Victory at Sea. These would be great addition to taps anywhere, let alone Vegas. Lots of German and Belgian drafts, and even some from Switzerland(!). Reasonably priced, too.  The service was also excellent. We arrived on time for our first reservation but our table wasn't ready. The manager greeted us, explained the situation and gave us a free round of drafts (it was a group of 8, so 8 free beers). He also stopped by the table later on to give us some samples of newly tapped beers. The waitstaff were also extremely friendly, efficient, and accommodating. They happily handled split checks, despite our large party size.  The downsides? Either the bartender or the waiter mucked up our beer orders a couple times (perhaps a lack of familiarity with the subject matter, since they weren't like-for-like mixups), but they made it right quickly and without fuss.  Did I mention the place is really affordable? Fully belly and a nice buzz for $27 + tip. Can't complain.

B9oVejiBwmxuoIfZEyYDVw.text: Okay, so I rarely dole out 5 star rating but IT&B is awesome. We went here after a long ass day and it was just what the doctor ordered.  We were greeted by one of the owners, whom was exceptionally nice and overly apologetic for the wait. We had a group of 7, no reservations and arrived at 7:30. We were expecting to wait, but he insisted it was abnormal and offered us each a drink as the restaurants apology.  We got a strawberry marg, Dirty South Andres and a traditional marg which all were awesome.  The chips, salsa and gauc are amazing. I'm from LA. We don't fuck around with chips and salsa so believe when I say they are good.  We all got tacos. An assortment. We got a both types of fish taco, carne asada, shrimp, chicken and carnitas and let's just say it was silent for 10 mins at our table of 6 girls and myself while we stuffed ours faces and looked up at each other reassuringly. If you're in Vegas and want a inexpensive meal - off the strip - go to IT&B. 5 stars. All night and day!  The decor is legit too. Chalked full of kitschy Mexican art and candles. I was a huge fan of the taco chested Virgin Mary in the entry!

t5v6J96wlJD2pTV57PVvnw.text: Excellent! Local vibes. Creative menu. Everything we ordered was delicious. Shrimp taco highly recommended along with bacon wrapped jalapenos. A nice break from prices and selection on the strip. Enjoy!

0Qoo0N6k9_BLCKTaydwQ3g.text: What a great find!  Comfortable atmosphere and friendly and attentive staff.  The guacamole is a must have.  The flautas are amazing.  Cant say enough about the tacos!  Al pastor is the best I have had.  Fish and shrimp tacos are amazing, as are the carne as well.  Great selection of beers as well.  I will be coming back!!

fVYjjSCOgxN20YdZtXlkGA.text: Really love this place!! Great food and service! Our server Justin was great very attentive.

QQk4nEnUzGJP_TTh_Rvfkw.text: We had amazing tacos here! Carne Asade rocks, shrimp tacos delight, queso models appetizer is to die for! Ask for Frank!

30Mz-nC0UJVwDTIkm1vfog.text: Imperial Tacos and Beer is an awesome place if you want great food and ambience. The food is really good and the service was great. Our server was Armando and he was great!

O_Oad_laIMt_Bg_9lsFJ6w.text: Good place to eat , tacos are amazing and they have house Tuesday's with a cool atmosphere and a mini dance floor out side with people dancing :) def a plus!!!

s9sGjqZ0j8EJPNAUd7fmiw.text: Love the rotating selection of craft beer, and the tacos are excellent. Really love this place. I always sit at the bar and get good service there.

R8AZ4jJNIPbCO5NYnf904w.text: This place is really good. One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas. The service is really good. Everyone is very attentive and experienced. We were served by Orlando. It was incredible how knowledgeable he was when it came to vegan/gluten free food. He helped us a lot with our choices and was very educated and polite. I highly recommend this place if you want to eat very tasteful Mexican food (except on Tuesday when they have a DJ playing and its usually packed).

lxHAv7AotJaMO8LS_oB0Xg.text: I had a great experience sitting at the bar, the bartender was very nice and the ambiance is great for watching a sporting event in a low key environment.   The items I had were:   Corn salad- more like a corn salsa, went well with the chips  Pineapple habenaro salsa- good flavor profile but didn't care for the apple sauce like consistency   Cilantro lime rice- cooked well but could barely make out the cilantro and lime   Carne Asada- extremely salty   Pork al pastor- this was my favorite of the three tacos because it had the most balanced flavors   Fish- very juicy fish but a little salty and was not a fan of the flour tortilla  Churros- cooked to perfection, maybe a little too much cinnamon sugar but this was my favorite of the night   Overall, this restaurant is very promising and sets itself apart from other Vegas restaurants with its friendly and competent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro&#39;s dulche de leche on the side
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish, carne asada, pork al pastor tacos
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn salad

Ywie_DcXQOErum9prT2jzA.text: This is by FAR one our favorite places to have taco Tuesday. The food is amazing and the prices are not high at all. The music is by local DJs and has a vibe that can't be matched!! The wait staff is always friendly and can recommend great things to try from food to drinks. We did meet one of the managers Manuel garza who took time to make sure we were all enjoying our evening. He suggested a taco we haven't tried and was on point!! He knows his restaurant and was really friendly.  One of the very BEST local spots in town :)

nG9l4NPd1q82XJJM_ETtSQ.text: Took a party of 5 for lunch. You have to pay for chips & salsa?  The chips were stale and they were very stingy with the chips. Had to ask for a refill 3 times before they refilled them. Tacos were ok at best. The asada has little taste. The al pastor was weak. The fish taco was good. Will not return.

2ZzNt24caPiesq0JiiFblA.text: Made a reservation for 8 people , and talked to the hostess and came in to the restaurant only to find out that they did not have a table available and didn't know when they would . Clearly seems like no one knows what they are doing . We were trying to show out of town friends a good time and it was embarrassing. Will not return .

4KVzzJfjO9t35fwH1hg4mg.text: Food was dry no flavor. Hot sauce taste like soy sauce with a bit of heat flavor added. All hype. Wouldn't eat here ever again. Even if was the last place on earth. Facts!!! Tacos taste like there wrapped in autumn leafs !

tB17E3I06xSQf49h3i5lQw.text: I don't see what all the hype on this place is. I tried three tacos and none were outstanding.  I had the carne asada,  the pastor,  and a fried fish taco.  Out of the three the fish was the best but it still wasn't great. Baja fresh has better fish tacos! I also ordered a chips and salsa very basic. The green salsa was pretty good.  I had a cold beer 4$ at happy hour.  All being said I was not very impressed and won't be back I think they're over hyped. There's better taco spots out there.

vAzfwlCWg1r1wuiB_pXU5A.text: Truly a great place to vibe in Las Vegas. With every kind of person you can imagine coming through in one day, this place takes the cake for tacos by the strip. The Tuesday night MNTRA TECHNO TACO TUESDAYS have been unforgettable and never leave us wondering why we stopped in. Thank you all for the great food and great entertainment. XO

G_tVlv9PPmSyt6cmckqG8w.text: One of my perennial 5-star places. If you like tacos and great Mexican food, you need to try this place. The quality is unmatched and the waitstaff is very good. The beer selection is constantly rotated and there is great attention to details so you know what you are getting.

TRWWN4ysEZKt7_6RUkT4tw.text: This wonderful place never fails to make my mouth happy. We always puck and share the different tacos. I would say that the shrimp and Carina's taco choices are hands down my favorites.  The crunchy beef is interesting as it has mashed potatoes in it. Tasty and one of the people in our group would say it's her favorite. The beer!! Oh it's great. I love sitting at the bar with chips and their various hot sauces....just trying all the different types on tap. I think it's usually 20 awesome unique types...the bartenders are always helpful in choosing different types based on personal preferences of the consumer. I go at least once every time that I'm in Las Vegas.  They have never dissapointed.

8emnnvNpaAQXUIr3ce5ezg.text: great tacos. very impressed! I had a trio, Carne Asada, Shrimp and Bahamas fish. the limes were very juicy.  I would have given a 4 star but the Michelada SUCKED!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1C-RIzwCPjgwVjWw5aFP1w.text: Melissa and Armando are amazing! Melissa made me a delicious margarita and mixed some really great cocktails for my friends! The bar has great music and he conversation is great!

12OOO3O2O23mbNbwCIlxyg.text: Sometimes you are in the mood for good tacos and a refreshing drink, and when that is the case, you should go to Tacos and Beer! Although the vibe was a bit off when I visited, the service and the food was great. The waiters promptly greeted us, took our order and made some awesome recommendations for us.  Although went for the happy our specials (tacos and margaritas), the available variety was awesome and, for just $2 a taco, you cannot go wrong with any of them. Even the tacos that are not included in the happy hour pricing, are still very affordable and of good value. We had the tinga, shrimp, pastor, carne asada, chicken and pork tacos and they were ALL delicious! I am not sure about the rest of their dishes, but if they are as good as the tacos, you should be safe ordering anything off the menu.  Before ending this review, I want to give them props for their passion fruit margarita. It is perfectly TART with balanced sweetness, so it is incredibly refreshing. I hope you like it as well.   Central location, good service, awesome tacos, incredible drinks. Definitely a place I will come back to.

WiZvt6V3GiwejHxLFTBAmA.text: Excellent service and ambiance. The bar staff service and skill level is top notch. They served the best cocktails I've had in a long time. The food is great and priced right. Great place for a date night. Special shout-out to Melissa the bartender! We loved her!

91cyivAo1BRN55HQoSjBlQ.text: If u go here ask to be seated in Franks area awesome Cuban guy. He's energetic and knows his way around the food menu. He recommended 3 different tacos and ways to spicy them up, literally spice them up and brought four different hot sauces. I love tacos with good hot sauce. They had 3 different types of just Hot sauce and a mild. Great service, cool vibes, and cool location.

Pb1Rjkbs8SbeKfhnwrKkig.text: Experience:  I had a groupon that included chips and guacamole, 6 tacos and two sides, so I brought my girl to check it out.  We actually hit it during happy hour too, so our beer was a very reasonable price too!  Service: we waited for a few minutes before anyone greeted us at the door.  The owner or manager finally came over and seated us.  He did apologize for the wait too.  Our waitress was ok...she was nice enough, just not very attentive. She was pretty busy, so it wasn't the best service. I'm reasonable about being busy, but when your waitress is the only one in the restaurant and she's too busy, that makes me think it's poor management.   Food: the guacamole and chips were good. I ordered the fish taco, shrimp taco and the crunchy taco that has mashed potatoes in it, and the cilantro rice for my side.  My fav was definitely the fish taco. The other two were good, but the fish taco was great!   I ordered a Tecate, but they serve it in a can. I sent it back, because I'm not a fan of canned beer. I feel like the waitress should have warned me.  So, then I ordered a grey lady beer, and it was actually very good.  It was a witbier or white beer. It's my first time trying it and I was impressed. Nice and light and even a little citrusy flavor....perfect because I did not want to fill up on beer.   Facility: this is a cute little casual spot with some outdoor seating too. Would be great to sit outside in nice weather during happy hour for cheap beer and $2 tacos!  Overall review: I am going to give this a 4 star, because of the lacking service. However, I do see me returning to this spot for more tacos and beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp, fish and Crunchy taco...all good, but fish was my fav.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grey Lady witbier...yum!
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and guacamole

NtOs39mrAK8zgiCPGCL2pg.text: Love the food.  I mean I LOVE LOVE LOVE the food here.  Only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because as I was waiting to be seated, their Security Guard (yes, their Security, not someone coming in after work) was drinking a beer outside the open door.

SZVJ0NTpZsWdq5T760kgqg.text: Chips and Salsa is good, not great... I prefer my salsa spicy vs sweet..... Corn salad was excellent! (Wish they served it hot instead of cold) Neighboring table had the Queso Modelo which looked amazing! Will definitely try next time!  Baja Fish Tacos are delicious!!! A very good portion of perfectly fried fish and then some cold slaw and REAL guacamole, next time I will order a little extra of the chili-lime crema sauce... Crispy Taco is a really good flavorful ground beef, but a little to heavy on the mashed potatoes for me.... still, and excellent taco.... I will definitely order again. What is better?????  Order the Carne Asada with the crispy shell.... Yay!!  Went for lunch during the work week...... couldn't drink  :(  can't wait to go back and try the margarita!

aj_nMtJ2Wl28bsg4sODW-g.text: Great tacos and decent cocktails, sat at the bar. service is lacking though, disappointing. Slow and disinterested, not welcoming for the most part.

LUODCdBfF8TTZvGpEDMcXA.text: Updated review: My wife and I returned for another try and although I initially wanted to give this place a 4star, I feel confident now in giving it a solid 5. We started with the TNB salad, and had a variety of 6 different tacos. We had the BBQ beef, shrimp, grilled fish, pibil, crunchy chicken, and the pastor. The pastor tacos are out of this world good, for sure favorite. I strongly suggest trying a few different ones, and sharing if need be. Looking forward to coming back to try the hurache, which is always a favorite dish of mine when I come across it on a menu.    I would have totally given this place a 4 star, but the service was really, really sub par. We had the dozen mini taco plate, and two full size pastor tacos, and the bacon wrapped jalapeno peppers. The jalapenos were really tasty, and the pastor tacos were fantastic. The dozen mini taco plate on the other hand, was a bit of a let down. Our server did not indicate to us that the minis are not served as they are described on the front of the menu. They are served with just the meat, cilantro and onions. Not as they are described with specialty toppings that I feel make the tacos unique. So do yourself a favor and order the specific tacos in full size form, they are totally worth it.

zTuvZGnIe5wW--gi1xR8NQ.text: I came into tacos and beer and Joaquin's skills in cocktails made my experience a fun one, he talked drinks to me , and I asked him to surprise me with something I may like, what he brought back to me was exactly what he said he would make me, thank you for being an awesome mixologist

cWbVGBfPGiaa9WylzRjH_A.text: Fact: I hated tacos UNTIL I came across this place!! I'm such a picky eater and I never convinced myself tacos were good until now. My friends suggested we eat here and already just hearing the name got me all skeptical because tacos AND beer aren't my thing.   Taking a look at the menu, they offer different varieties of tacos. From shrimp, beer-battered or grilled fish, to grilled skirt steak, bbq beef, etc., I completely avoided the taco section and got a Steak Hurache, but when I found out you can get a lettuce wrap instead of the tortilla it was game over for me!! My first round I ordered two shrimp tacos and grilled fish all with lettuce wrap. I fell in love with the sauce, it goes great with the lettuce. I knew I was getting full but that didn't stop me from getting two more orders of the shrimp tacos. It was bomb!! The portions aren't small either, great to size and worth the price. The Steak huarache on the other hand was forgotten, my boyfriend ended finishing my dish because I totally abandon it. It was a little dry, but came with a lot of sides.   Okay technically I'm cheating because I replace the shell with lettuce, but it's definitely a start! Ever since I left the place I've been craving it every day. The only downside is that it's a little too far and there's no other locations, but worth the drive!!

hEIrHUFMlC2-K3rEHnKLLg.text: This is one of my absolute favorite spots for some amazing mouthwatering enchiladas. That's my usual plate. However today I decided to change things up a bit and went with a shrimp cocktail, a taco de lengua and of course I never not have their cilantro rice. It is to die for! As always great service! And the vibe and atmosphere is vibrant.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can never not have their white rice. Yum!!
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If this doesn&#39;t make your mouth water I don&#39;t know what Will!

qiQnFIC20PJWfNXIdO62uw.text: Went for a quick bite and stayed longer just to stuff more tacos in my belly. Awesome vibe, love the poster art up on the walls, framed well and good artist choices. Loved it Good beer and good tacos, that simple.  GO!

V4Opq1F5v13ITXMTRe2LCA.text: This amazing place has the greatest selection of craft beer and tons of Vegan options listed on the menu and off menu Began options if you ask the server. The Craft beer was all quality weather it was common or rare. They have draft, bottles, and cans. We were very happy with our Tacos and Beer!

PFS0ziUVSbpn2yayU38KSA.text: Favorite place to eat tacos! the staff is super friendly and the decor of the whole place is amazing. The tacos are all made to order. Personally the most important thing is how it all tastes so amazing. My husband and I have been coming here for over 2 years and it NEVER disappoints!

QVCZI5562p9sQ8b6U49FWg.text: This place is always packed and I haven't had the balls to sit alone and eat. But today I made the leap and I'm so greatful I did!!!! Athena the bartender was AMAZING!!!! She recommended one great thing after another!! The ceviche is the best I've ever had and I've had some amazing ceviche!! Then Athena recommended the taco with "mashed potatoes " .... what... it's called the "crunchy" shut the front door so amazing!! Then I had the beef Barbacoa, shrimp and the "Rojas con cream" I'm HOOKED ... Athena made me feel so welcomed to Vegas and I am happy to say I have found a great place to call my home town taco joint and bar!!  Thank You Athena!!

NHZ6U4_ANJ4qu_JbQkMEqg.text: Really love this place.  It's off the strip, but not difficult to access and doesn't cost much for a cab or Uber.  They have every conceivable type of taco and I love the variety.  I love that they make the their tortillas from scratch.  I love their additions to their guacamole, which is great.  It's always a must stop on our trips to Vegas.

gxkZhfFwVwCJkasG3AHdCw.text: BEST TACOS IVE EVER HAD!!  Tacos & Beer what a fantastic combination.. I ordered Postmates for lunch today and I tried the carne asada fries and the shrimp tacos. I've gotta say, although I've had better carne asada fries.. I have not had better tacos than these. They are a bit pricey, however it is SO worth it! I look forward to trying the fish tacos next. They are about $4.15 per taco, however there is a lot of meat and veggies that fill the tortilla.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tacos are the best tacos..

Zu30ZM2fURg-FK8x0uLwAg.text: There are two types of people who go to Las Vegas - those who are content with the same crappy chain restaurants they have in their town, and then those who want an awesome taste experience.  The latter should go to Tacos and Beer for awesome food, a great beer selection, fun decor, and friendly, attentive staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trifecta of deliciousness.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eclipse from FiftyFifty Brewing Co.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon Raisin Commodore from Ballast Point.

I4fLVUogrikW1Fx3QWVc1w.text: AMAZING food, average service. I always go back because the food is so good but I wish they would step up their customer service a bit

jkhVhX5bIKfLWir2BJiCpg.text: We stopped here based on other yelp reviews and were not disappointed. Service was quick, friendly and the recommendations were spot on. This is not something you get at every stop in Vegas :) food was delicious, beer choices were endless. Will definatly come again in our next trip

GFzyUWkwRWBdGGFGwNGlkA.text: Must have Mash N'Vanilla Barleywine!! Street tacos are delish. Carnitas was my favorite. Excellent service too!!

-E0l3M8bJjAnsX5bfGpOMw.text: Absolutely AMAZING tacos! New favorite taco spot in Vegas. Priced well and great atmosphere. Also, the Jalapeno poppers are delicious!

tfMWC1f_fIj0eLXN8B94bw.text: This is one of my favorite place to eat and I always hope Jackie is are waitress she is on point  and always making sure are glasses are full and getting us anything we need!

NHM8FGaW6xZPl7c78kEYxg.text: They specialize in two things and they're both in the name. The tacos are amazing and the beer selection has something for everyone.  We ordered from there twice with huge orders for 12 hungry people. Both times the orders were exactly right, labeled clearly, and delicious! One night they were slammed, one night they were about to close.

I7YwPLdU99VsJ9A4h4_F3w.text: Loved every single moment of the experience.  This was a great experience we were able to have with family. The food...my kids still talk about how good it was

oUF3tQZFQ9MpHOMe7J4GfA.text: Tacos and beer was the perfect place to be! Our bartender Natascha was the absolute best!! She went above and beyond to make our experience lovely! & makes the best margs(:!  This place is a must for tacos and drinks!

jC-bUe5ZvrCXaUbYmjqvvA.text: This place has a good vibe... But the shrimp tacos are absolutely AMAZING!! All the tacos were good but If you try different tacos, try the shrimp one last bc its the BEST!

Q-3yzqEXg9q8Zb7Isfp0tA.text: Great tacos!! I ordered the Barbacoa, Al Pastor and the shrimp taco.  The Barbacoa was the best one!  Al pastor, the meat was juicy and delicious but I personally am not a fan of pineapple in my taco.  Shrimp taco was decent, nothing special. They all were still worth traveling down to try. On Tuesdays tacos are .50 off!   Definitely try this place.  Love their beer selection too.  Great, fast service.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left to right: shrimp, al pastor, Barbacoa ( Barbacoa is the best!)

QKSj9Y0GXk2pIEoKybTZYA.text: Found this place on yelp and went for it; happy we did. Chose to sit on the patio which is always nice weather permitting. Our group orders guac and chips, tortilla soup and fish taco and beer. All were really good. Fresh guacamole, salty chips, hearty soup and battered fish. We will all definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baja Fish Taco
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh made guac
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tortilla soup. Yum

4hi9jp7Hc22f7Lj2WY925w.text: Great Tacos, especially the one with Chicharron inside of it. The Jalapeno Martini is pretty good as well...

z-r29B0llkdPRgiHhBwZBw.text: Seriously. Seriously. This place. I just can't. Their food if stoopid fantastic. I actively have to talk myself out of going sometimes cause I would be there everyday (I do go once a week though). By far my favorite restaurant in Vegas. I've tried about 1/2 of the menu so far (only half because I have some favorites that I HAVE to have when I'm there) and everything has been amazing. I will warn you though...if you are considering the Carne Asada Fries...prepare to share or take some home...it's massive. If you are visiting Vegas - it's so worth the Uber or the cab cost to taste this place!

GcsY2WwTIRGcm4fTKCKn7g.text: Waiter Alfredo was the best! The food & drink were exceptional! Anytime in the area is a must!

PQnnR6sLvaH8JS9Pjw_TsA.text: Although the this place has amazing handmade tortilla tacos and beer the service today was mediocre at best one of the waitresses would only ask my boyfriend for refills on his drink and not me... I feel if you are going to serve a table make sure everyone is taken care of not just one person... My first time I came the service was awesome but it could have been because the owner was here so everyone was on their best behavior...I will come back again but I hope the staff can display the same awesome service I had my first time

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foooood glorious food!!!! Hahahaha

WeJYkb1FO1ct2JaoZ_km8A.text: Hands down the best tacos Tuesday in Las Vegas. A must do! The manager Manuel was also very attentive and came over multiple times to check on our table. Even with how busy it was! Great vibe and great food!

9coPk6hRVj_0tr-sKLTV1Q.text: been here a few times and I would love to go again. The tacos are reasonably priced and reasonably sized. I love that they have such a big variety of tacos to choose from. They have a corn appetizer that is delicious. Can't go without getting a jalapeno margarita!!!

MrFNZaJz2bnzi1yBTb2ERA.text: I love this place! We came here while visiting Vegas. Amazing food and atmosphere! Great service as well!  A few weeks ago we met Manuel, one of the managers and he's great. He is always running around the floor making sure his customers and staff are doing well. I work at a restaurant myself and I notice these little things. Keep up the good work Tacos & Beer!

x-x0LigtRTxtHKMbvX34wg.text: It was our first time at Tacos & Beer! We really enjoyed the food, service, & atmosphere! Our server Alberto was very informative & made great suggestions with the food, beers, & cocktails! We'll definitely be back!

gOEtmxscjX4W8N2Vv3kXBA.text: I always come to Tacos and Beer and I'm never disappointed. My boy Oscar hooked us up tonight with excellent service. He was on point and checked on us frequently. My girlfriend is vegetarian so we got 2 tacos with no meat, as a meat eater these tacos were out of this world. Don't be afraid to try a few things out of your comfort zone, everything is really good here. Just tried the choco taco for dessert tonight that Oscar recommended and it was amazing. The horchata ice cream was on point! If you are in the area, COME THRU it's bomb

5pUs5svAcacLuZ4oxMAPjg.text: Amazing service Oscar and Manuel take great care of us. Highly recommend you check out this place! Great food and service I will definitely be back!

B4DQxcPJCW-9s01Htgzstw.text: I have to agree with several of the recent reviews; service was spotty, flavors were fine but muddled and several things all tasted the same. Exceptions that stood out were the jalapeno poppers and the queso fundido.

FuIrtoQR1frWiSGwmxfThQ.text: Very good food, service and salsa. Many healthy and unique choices on the menu.  Few places offer habanera hot sauces made daily so if you like spicy, Tacos and Beer is for you. Rachael made the dining experience a pleasure.  Even the cops eat there.

PaewI9_QAIlnqkosu8gm4A.text: Excellent selection. This is a great spot to sit, chat while drinking a beer and watching a game on tv. Food is superb and staff is friendly. Highly recommend the Cheesy Taco with mashed potatoes!  Great selection of craft beers. Highly recommend.

hs0Uued-02h9ardV7tu5DA.text: Great mango margaritas, mango fish taco are the best! I tried their salad and it was okay.

1F9zfm0aKcqyGBxYHacsHg.text: This review is strictly about the happy hour which I have never come for before. Anyhow, it basically sucks because for food there are only 4 tacos and the Rajas tacos is the same price it normally would be which makes no sense of how its "happy hour". I wish they had maybe few more happy hour food options. Also I'm surprised they don't serve chips and salsa like most Mexican restaurants, I means it fine but it would be a plus!

8H591CV44mkXT30OruXpmw.text: Cool environment. We sat outside and it was nice and comfortable. It was really busy, but it didn't take long to get a table. The tacos were good. We ordered almost every taco on the menu. The al pastor, shrimp, and lengua were my favorites. The Margaritas were poured just right and the come with this cool foaming salt on top. On tuesdays they do Techno Taco Tuesday. They play Techno music and after eleven is happy hour. Seafood tacos are $3. All other tacos are $2. Select Craft beers are $3. Margaritas are $4 and really good. Check it out you'll definitely have a great time. Date night or pre-game.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Techno Taco Tuesday. Tacos, tequila, and good company. What else could you ask for?

sT9KmNx2IqbxnhuH09T8iw.text: Amazing environment! Tacos Tuesday is a must and so is their Frozen Margaritas! Special Thanks to Manuel and Saiid for providing such exceptional service and making our experience much more than what was required and expected!

r6JuUotbfquPS3urLsxoww.text: Came here during lunch time. Located a little bit off the strip. Kind of hidden. Ordered up the barbacoa and lengua tacos. Not bad. The hot sauces they provide are a bit mediocre. Chips and salsa are mot complimentary. Order came with charred jalapenos. Some were mild and some were super spicy. So watch out.

NTAeSGXIzC0iXWZapYU36w.text: I love this place they have great vegetarian options. The food was very delicious and the outside patio was nice. Also the staff is great especially Frawk and Carlos!! I would definitely come back and eat here again!!

QutkHsAufnEshe2EmnIArw.text: The food was amazing! The queso was my favorite but you have to get them with corn tortillas they are made fresh in house!! Next time I am in Vegas I will be back.

y-0tk2s2sbp0KMr_VffDdg.text: Great craft beer selection!!!! Great great great! Love the food and atmosphere as well.   Have tried nearly all the tacos and all are great. Craft cocktails are good too but the beer list is impressive. Super close to the strip but away from the action. Love the location.

cfvTpAWzhXBrq-d7u3Nlgg.text: A great local find!  Good food, reasonable prices!  Try the bacon wrapped jalapenos, they were super yum and not spicy!

vIt_ktmhLceb4g6dOOnvPw.text: Came to tacos and beer for happy hour today for the first time. I was pleasantly surprised! I'm always happy to see quite a few vegetarian options on the menu. The veggie taco was delicious! I can't wait to try to jicama salad next time.  We had 3 tacos, 2 margaritas and 2 Pacificos for 20 bucks! Can't beat that!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7JvVkwHCkpfP591cK48INQ.text: This is the best place in Vegas for craft beer and tacos. Both are on point, highly varied and unique, affordable, and most importantly, freaking delicious! The staff is great and the GM is a fellow beer enthusiast, super knowledgeable and all around nice guy. They do various tap takeovers with awesome breweries and are hooked up with amazing places so you'll always have an awesome selection of beers. Their selection blew me away for sure! This will forever be a place I visit each time I go to Vegas!

WGOmXz52hjRfgIfNORwj3g.text: One of my favorite places to visit on #TacoTuesday Tacos are $.50 off and the variety is amazing! Make sure you save room for dessert, the churros and chocolate tacos are great but the FLAN is outstanding! Trust me, you'll thank me later

This place has potential, but as someone with 15+ yrs experience in the industry, in my opinion this establishment needs some serious management, my wife and i came in three different times, not once were we  satisfied with the service, food and margaritas are great. But their servers and sertain Bartenders are definately in the wrong industry.   F.Y.I. Miserable service=miserable tips guys.

Xa4WYnNqJrKz-K1mjJVmBQ.text: Glad me and my partner gave this joint another shot. The hospitality this evening was divine. Maybe we caught him on a bad day in the past. Will definitely be back. The food was out of this world.

1e0M7vOukBk1_LBGbklrbQ.text: This our favorite place in Vegas. The food is always delicious and the service was exceptional this time. rA0BpD2GzydwVqYJZ02egw.text: I mean who can go wrong with tacos and beer??? shrimp tacos are just about the best i have ever had... Great place, gotta give it a try!

WZdHnACLuyDXRB-J53QjxQ.text: UPDATE: My boyfriend and I have been coming here EVERY Sunday night for as long as we can remember. We've also come on other nights when we crave their veggie tacos, including on "Techno Taco Tuesdays." Tonight is "Techno Taco Tuesday," and I guess they have started a new cover fee program, charging $5 per person to enter the restaurant. Huh? I just want my veggie tacos. I'm not a fan of techno music at all. I am not here to party. We just want to eat. I've never before heard of a place putting an extra charge to enter the restaurant on top of buying food and drinks. Even the top nightclubs in town don't charge cover if you get a table! The cover charge amount is not the issue...yes, we did pay the extra $10 so we could get our food and drinks. My issue is the principle! They are taking advantage of people that just want to eat at the restaurant. They should just charge the people trying to party, not the people that are just trying to eat.   Old review: My boyfriend & I came in on Nacho House Sundays last Sunday night around 1am. We have recently been cutting down our meat consumption so we gave the veggie tacos a try this time. We each got a beef taco and 2 veggie tacos. OH MY GOD! The veggie tacos were by far the best ever! We both preferred them to our usual favorites. You know a restaurant is good when their veggie dishes are just as good as their meat dishes! The food is always solid here, and the drinks are usually on point as well.  I have complained in the past about the volume of the music, but this time it was low enough that we could hear each other while we were eating (at the furthest table from the DJ booth). After eating, we walked outside to the DJ playing some great old school soul music. I am not a fan of their Techno Taco Tuesdays, but man do I LOVE their Nacho House Sundays! We ended up staying an extra half hour dancing with everyone else I the dance floor. So much fun!!! We are definitely looking forward to spending every future Sunday night here!!!!

m36FCT8b79L0t--RGgqLug.text: Went back again and still in love!   It was Taco Tuesday when we went in so we knew to make reservations through open table therefore had no wait at all! NE2s4FlTjFs5xyGrN-albA.text: Love this place! It can get really loud and crowded easily. The bar tenders are a little slow on getting drinks to the table or if you are sitting there. But the chips and salsa are on point you get 2 different types that you can eat while you wait for your food.

Va17yGY98gT6P6CTLQZAjw.text: Definitely one of the best shrimp cocktails I've ever had!! I didn't need to add a thing. It was very tasty! Beer & tinga are excellent!  It's become a regular stop when I'm in Vegas.

-oeDeVubVCBQuH4uM2FQlQ.text: My sales team and I came here for dinner and we had a great time.  The wait staff was great and the food was delicious. I ordered guacamole and chips for an appetizer.  I was hoping for homemade chips but they were from a bag.  The guacamole was good though.  I had a very tasty chicken empanada and a gigantic chicken burrito.  My favorite was the churro. UZSD6Xn6xh-isD--9P5jgA.text: This place is amazing. Seriously some of the best tacos I've ever had and they have something for everyone. Vegan tacos for me, vegetarian for my boyfriend, and plenty of ones with meat and cheeses in them for our friends! Whatever you want me up ordering here, you're going to love. (Although I highly recommend getting the jackfruit tacos even if you're not vegan or vegetarian)  Staff has always been super friendly here, drinks are great, and the atmosphere is wonderful as well. If you have a chance to, you need to head here!

jdSle1KTw7a58T8Y3_fEPQ.text: Stopped by this place for lunch on our last day in Vegas to get away from the strip. The beer selection was awesome and the selection of tacos were amazing. Definitely would come again the next time we are in the area. Lily was awesome!

KsK03pp7wkiGE28uOdk2rQ.text: 5 star for food-3 star for service=4 star because of good management.   As someone who doesn't eat meat or cheese it is generally pretty hard to find a place with good tacos. Yes, there are places that offer meatless tacos, but they aren't always good. Come on-- no one wants to eat just a tortilla with a few fillers. Tacos are supposed to be all about the vibrant flavor of a simple comfort food. When I found Tacos & Beer while preparing for a Vegas trip, I was thrilled to find out that they offered vegan options. My husband and I added it to the top of our list of places to go.  As soon as we made it to Vegas, our first destination turned out to be here. I was pleasantly surprised to walk into the coolest taco space that I've been. You can find candle holders hanging from the ceiling, sweet decor, and friendly faces.   I started my visit here by ordering the chips and salsa. Yes-you do have to pay for it, but the salsa is soooo damn good. It's most definitely worth the $3. Our order arrived shortly after ordering. As soon as the plate was served, I had the most beautiful sight looking back at me. 3 perfectly plated vegan tacos were right before my eyes. They include a grilled pineapple and black bean taco, jackfruit carnitas, and beer battered avocado. My husband and I already started discussing when we could plan to come back again during our trip.  Unfortunately, our next visit was NOT so great. We arrived with two other friends but decided to order our food to-go instead of waiting for a table. This wasn't a problem at all because we only cared about the food, not where we were going to eat it at. All 4 of us ordered our food and then stood by the door to wait for it. After a few minutes, my husband and I decided to go snag two seats at the bar because we were exhausted after a long day. Immediately the bartender(Karen or Kerri) rolled her eyes and demanded that we give her our ID's. As we were getting our ID's out, I smiled and let her know that we had just ordered food to go and that we wouldn't be ordering any alcohol because we don't really drink. She immediately got an attitude and told us that if we weren't ordering a drink that we couldn't sit there and would need to get up for someone else. I was shocked! My husband and I travel to many places to try new restaurants and do reviews and NEVER have we been told that we can't sit at the bar and need to give up our seats for someone else. I'm really hoping that this wasn't because we are an interracial couple. There were other seats at the bar, the bartender was still able to make money, and she was busy anyway. I'm not sure what the issue was, but this is totally unacceptable. As soon as the next couple sat down, she had a beaming smile and loudly welcomed them.   We requested to speak with a manager and the other staff members quickly worked to try to resolve the problem. The manager was at the sister location so we opted for a phone call instead. My husband and his friend (a Local) both talked to the manager on duty who was incredibly nice and apologized for the incident. They offered us a credit for a future visit, but we opted to not use it since it wasn't the businesses fault but an employees. It seems that the manager and other staff members do care about the customers. Overall the food here is amazing, but the service the 2nd visit really made us change our view.

xi4bpRn4KculAYDEEEgB-g.text: Shelly was amazing! Very attentive and genuine. Service was prompt and Julian kept our table clean and chips refilled. very happy. If you like tacos come here :) Will return!!

e2XCgGMy_0Q24kz2c67WUg.text: This was recommended by a staff person at a near by hotel and it was amazing!  The carne asada taco had such incredible flavor.  The staff were very welcoming and responsive.  Prices were very affordable.  Exceptional drink menu and plenty of taps.  I will definitely be back!

4V-k6DHaNMPCrVAc5bsWmg.text: Amazing food! I had the jackfruit taco, veggie empanada, and a side order of corn salad; all were really good. Someone at my table had the al pastor taco and the chicken taco; the al pastor meat was very tasty. The other person at my table has the carne asada fries; it was a big plate with a lot of flavor. We ended the meal with choco tacos and churros; delicious! Great tap list too.

YhXEoqzroa9iMETr3w0i0A.text: This was my first experience here and with it being a Sunday night I got exactly what I expected. There was no rush and everything we ordered came in a speedy manner. Our server was Allen(I went with a frat brother of mine) and he treated us very well. He was knowledgeable of the menu when we asked what was good and what he would recommend. The only problem I had (why they got 4 stars) is because my order came out wrong twice. Once on a drink order and another on one of my taco orders. I should be giving 5 stars because Allen offered to give me the wrong taco for free (he handled the situation very well) but the third thing that got me was the portion size compared to the price. I tried the carne asada, chicken asada, and carnitas tacos which were all marinated and seasoned very well with a good portion of each topping but the tacos were so small that if you are a big eater you're gonna have to order A lot.

VyUeRGj3NchPcTsUmoBUrQ.text: Wow! This place is awesome all because of our server lily! It was mine & my husbands first time and Lily made our first time so memorable! Best service hands down, we will be back!

Szusp-PqtOSQqpfVYEwzew.text: This place is actually soooo so good! I love the crispy bean and cheese taco, the chicken taco, and the dessert taco is DE-lish! The tacos are a little pricey for tacos but 100% worth every penny! Guac and salsa are good too! This food is so fresh and full of flavor, go there once and your standard for tacos will change forever

_Ab8ghp47SeB8dbEgitQBg.text: Wanna be surprised by beer, this is your spot, everytime there's a new variety... Speaking about food, ohh man, just came back from Mexico (The motherland) and tacos never tasted better... Lucas can give you a super service and create and outstanding dining atmosphere, ask for him everytime you are here, funny and professional together. A regular for sure!!!

OasMnFIduDtUePXpkLYxCA.text: We arrived at around 3:50pm ask to sit on the balcony. The balcony was mess, we had to move the table around ourselves.   The tables where all wobbly, the screws on the bottom need to be tightened. Chairs are very uncomfortable. The wooden taco tray holder where warped and need replacement.   Food was good but it no worthy a return trip.  Service was adequate (buss boy was great)!  This was my third and last visit!! It nice for a light lunch and a first try, just no worthwhile returning.

yJ__SSkWeaKZL195aF6j9Q.text: I have no idea what the hype is about, the tacos were super mediocre & luke warm, the chips & salsa took for ever to come out as well as our food even though it was kinda empty! the salsas were tasteless, both drinks I ordered from their menu they did not have, mind u one was a simple blended margarita. Just a bad experience all around, definitely can't come back.

VYAjh9xSjncEexsdVRY-eg.text: This place is amazing! Everything from the chips and guacamole to the floutas and tacos were amazing. Don't forget to order the refreshingly delicious margaritas as well!   Everything had great flavor, was perfectly cooked and fresh ingredients. If I lived in Vegas I would be there once a week for sure.  Order the fish Baja taco! So delicious!!

-YZj1mlzU5pQcsrGKP3Wlg.text: I've been here a few times and it's been consistent for me every time.  It's not groundbreaking and they don't have the best tacos in the world but the flavors are solid and I never have an issue.    On this particular occasion, my friend ordered a large margarita but received the smaller one.  The waiter seemed concerned but was able to convince us this was the better choice as the value for alcohol content is better.  He even came back with a half margarita to make up for the mistake, which I think was really appropriate.  The tacos are all unique and heavily flavored.  I'm kind of a purest and like my tacos to be more simple but that doesn't mean I don't appreciate what Tacos & Beer is trying to do here.    Being so close to my job, my coworkers often come here for celebrations, good byes and just to hang out.  It's a pretty solid choice for any occasion.

f_TsFO5qXJvK4L28ogKYfw.text: I can't say enough about this place but FOODIES YOU MUST STOP HERE! The creativity of the taco menu is exceptional. They even have vegan and vegetarian offers. I tried 2 vegan and one veggie... my mouth died a little knowing it won't get something that good for a while! They also have an incredible drink menu. As a lot of taco shops do they have a Taco Tuesday and I just happened to be there for it. Tacos are at a discounted price and you are not getting these tiny street tacos. I was amazed at the size.   When here, order the margarita and  try a sampling of a number of the tacos. Your stomach will be happy you did!

7gn3slXZm0TrCRb4fJn41A.text: Since 2012 Ive come here for tacos and drinks. Friendly staff, prompt service cool music and unique wood carvings all around. Coco Loco and choco taco make life better!

eJsqVrgeCzTxc9uIKjwPow.text: Don't waste your time. Service is terrible and they never get your order right. The last 3 times I've been here they messed up my order. I told the waiter before we ordered about my past 2 experiences hoping this would be a pleasant experience boy was I wrong. I ordered chips and salsa that never came and they messed up not only my tacos but the amount of tacos I ordered. All I wanted was chips and salsa and 3 chicken tacos and to top it off they were not busy when I was last there . Good luck tacos and beer I was rooting for you to well but with the inconsistency on messing up orders and the extremely high employee turnover over ratio I will find a new late eatery.

aGCGDffUCdWr482ajEAYYg.text: Great ceviche and probably one of the BEST margaritas ever!  The service is unparalleled. Lots of options for tacos and their prices are ridiculously cheap! They don't take reservations but super easy to work with. Perfect for large groups and families.  Make this place a priority when you're in Vegas!

7JviwAFYOZ0me4pF-ekosQ.text: I love their empanadas!!! I would go to tacos El gordo for anything pork related but their chicken was good.   My friend had the nachos and loved them, I loved my veggie empanada and avocado beer battered tacos.   My jackfruit tacos needed more shredding and cooking and the pineapple tacos disappointed me because I expected to see grilled pineapples and all I got was beans   Our female server sucked, hate to say it, but there were a lot of attentive busboys and other servers who looked out for us   Going back one more time and hope to update my review to 5 stars because I really want to like this place lol the decor is great!!

Uhe5L8xK4L4MIKT7NRvseA.text: Amazing tacos. Fresh tasting ingredients, tastes like real homemade cooking. A must try. Little far from the the strip but so worth it to come here and try their food here. Service was quite fast and staff was friendly. Very romantic ambiance, and good music. Their homemade chips and salsa is one of the best I've tried so far.

SBglt5RV4neAesYmJJ_CtA.text: Came here on a Saturday night with my friend, before a concert. She made a reservation for 6:15 online through Yelp. She said it popped up when she was reading reviews, which is very convenient! There were still a few open tables, however, when we got there.   The decor is cute. It's in the old Firefly location on Paradise, but only half of it. I believe the other half is a sushi place.   We both ordered a veggie empanada and some beer to start. Unfortunately I do not remember the name of mine. It's on the fruity list, and came in a light blue almost Hawaiian can. Only complaint I have is that my friend had taken a drink of the beer that had been left in the can, and the server walked by and poured it in to my glass of beer without asking. I'm a weirdo about spit, so I was very turned off by this. The can wasn't even sitting by me. I know he didn't know better, but still.   The veggie empanadas were very good! I ate all of it, including the side ingredients on the plate!  I also ordered the jackfruit carnitas taco, and the beer battered avocado taco - both vegan. The jackfruit carnitas was pretty good, could use a little more "umph". Still overall pretty tasty. The beer battered avocado taco was my favorite by far. The avocado was crisp and not mushy like I half expected. Very tasty.   There are a few things I would like to go back and try for sure. Service was good, not too crowded, and pricing was good!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jackfruit carnitas taco, and beer battered avocado taco. Both vegan - both awesome!
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie empanada. Demolished the whole thing!

rdIudupl4sVk7J8m9j55ig.text: Went during the day at a not so busy time and I waited around 30 minutes for someone to come to the table to take the order.  4 different waiters walked by making eye contact and no one bothered to take the initiative to get someone to place our order. Super disappointed  The aesthetic is very pleasing, from the Virgin Mary holding a holy taco down to the hanging candle lights. Too bad I didn't get a chance to eat there due to their poor service

oab3CHIF1kssVICjtPpOZw.text: We were there Friday night , ambiance was relaxed and fun! Lily was an amazing server. She was very efficient , friendly and patient  as we were new to tacos and beer! She helped us navigate the big selection of tacos (btw all are AMAZING!) my favorite was the al pastor taco. They put their own little twist to it and it's delicious! Also try the tinga empanada which my server suggested and it was beyond expectations! Definitely coming back here !

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CPhVY4yZiCQoXxR_naV0LQ.text: My server AJ is a class act in this industry & deserves to be recognized! I was so impressed by how professional & genuine his service was. I have been working in hospitality for a long time & recognize the amazing service that he demonstrated towards myself and all his guests that night. He also showed leadership amongst his coworkers & explained how he really cared to see them succeed. Thanks again to AJ & the great service given by the entire team. Not only is the service awesome but this place has amazing tacos and margaritas!

g3Jt9cL68nTK_X3HmKubCQ.text: Came here for a date and I'd say we had a good experience. The tacos were delicious, and I only regret not getting another one. They were not as expensive as I thought they were going to be, and we even shared a side that was pretty good. The beer part was also a good experience. I ordered the Romeo and Julius, which was pretty tasty. Although I wish they had more options, I liked the lineup they had. It wasn't too busy, and it seems like it has a pretty "current" vibe all around.

Zg_s-SIFWfi6w5wd7AZyuQ.text: Let's just say I'm not a big fan of this place. As many times as I've been here and given it so many tries. I really don't love it.   I've tried all the tacos, ceviche, cocktail and fries. The ONLY thing that I can say I enjoyed was the micheladas! Well that's the only thing I remember I liked...till this recent visit. Jonathan was our server..I'm assuming because his name was on our receipt. But he wasn't a good server at all and he was rude about my drink order.   We were the last to join the table...and he came and took everyone's order and then just left when it came to mine and my boyfriends order. My friends even asked if we ordered yet...and we said no. He finally comes back around and asks if we want anything to drink..I asked for a michelada and he asks what beer I wanted, I said modelo. Jonathan tells me they don't have modelo and continues to tell me what beers they have. He recommended Dos esquis...I asked what it tasted like because I'm not a huge beer drinker and like light beers. Jonathan than looks at me and says "if you are getting a michelada, it doesn't matter! You can't tell the difference!"   I beg to differ, I replied back "actually if you know a good michelada than you can tell the difference"   I'm definitely not saying I'm a connoisseur by any means. But you can tell when anything tastes bitter or not good! So for him to say that like I'm new at drinking was actually pretty rude of him and to talk to any customer that way is not good service. And the beer he recommended was bitter and I did not enjoy it. So for the last resort of actually liking something at this restaurant has now gone to nothing.   I definitely will not be going back or recommending it to anyone for food nor service!

vK08sANYbr60tXdjWS0VWw.text: Not sure why I loved this place so much, I am still wondering if it's due to the fact that I was drunk. And I am wondering why this place has such a high rating -- it might also be due to the fact that we are in Vegas and people are often drunk too.   A few things I want to point out though; first, the parking is not a friendly parking lot. I was approached by some guy who asked me for money first and as I refused to contribute to his cause he became physical. Second, reservation is a must, unless you are willing to wait over an hour.   This place has the biggest selection of tacos you'll ever see. From veggie tacos to pineapple black bean taco or avocado-potato taco. You'll never get tired. Since I was with a bunch of friends we decided to ordered a large sample with pretty much any taco that was on the menu.   If I had to choose the best ones I would said the Al Pastor and the Rajas Con Crema tacos are the finest, although my friends and I had a hard time to agree on the finest options. That seemed a positive sign as we figured this place would make pretty much anyone happy. And for dessert Choco Tacos, so amazingly delicious.   The bar has a terrific menu too, the selection of beer rocks and the mezcal and tequila options will keep you looking forward to your next visit.   As long as you do not get shot at the parking lot you'll fall in love with this place. Just remember, make use of the second amendment and securely bring your gun. By doing that you'll be making sure you have an exceptional experience while not dieing while you go through it.

CtcpST_P9C2ndCFG0hsVIw.text: Love this place! I am a local and it's so nice to go to a bar with no gambling! I sat at the bar tonight on a taco Tuesday night and got attentive service. The micheladas were amazing and tacos are full of flavor. So many options! I will be back to try more.

5O6Job6-X-dccfyMAtZwQg.text: Tacos didnt quite deliver on the hype for me, but i got to have the prarie birthday bomb stout so i was quite happy.   The beer peeps here are definitely making good calls. Super dope selection. 20 taps isnt a lot by todays standard but they had more stuff i wanted than most places boastinf 50 or 100 drafts  Dont get me wrong though..tacos are legit. Service with a smile. Nice breal from the strip

KuHnB_m0B3ELhaROE5XmEg.text: Amazing tacos, seriously go eat here! I get three tacos when I go of a variety of flavors, I love their fish taco and crunchy taco, but I honestly think all of them are so good that we have tried, huge menu of options. Good house margaritas and huge beer list. Love it!

ukLik0PCQiTQ8aoigM13iw.text: Serena is awesome! She made our time wonderful!! Very attentive and the main reason we love tacos and beer so much!

W6TqNHvuaRrsdhp-CHQKew.text: Lily was a badass. Was feisty and just came to the table just the right amount! We never had to ask for anything extra as she was on top of it all and read our minds. It was my wife's birthday and my wife thought she was hott and she is picky! So thanks Lily! I hope this made you laugh. Thanks for your help! We will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos and Beer!

1gWuDZ_vJw2aGjJpKYhhAg.text: This doesn't even deserve a star so here we go. We were seated pretty quickly with our family to celebrate my cousins 21st birthday dinner. But things went south pretty quick. First off our server when he was taking our drinks kept flipping around his notepad like he wasnt even paying attention which proved True because he forget about 3 drinks and my cousin had ordered a modelo which never came, then when we asked for her beer he informed us that they didn't have modelo. Ummm okay why wouldn't you mention that first ?? Second we tried to order chips and salsa when we put our drinks in and didn't even get those until our food was about to come out.   Third my husband had ordered a taco salad and asked for steak. Only for them to forget to bring it out but once it came out it had no meat at all. When we asked the server about the meat he then proceeded to say that he asked him if he wanted meat in it. Thanks for insulting when we already had asked for meat. The food was great but service was just terrible. We definitely will not be back at this establishment. Wish the service was better.

T-yI9S5IdP95jSDfkoVt5Q.text: This restaurant needs to make sure their online website hours reflect the time of service. We arrived only to be told that they were closing early - and no apology/empathy to acknowledge the discrepancy. Terrible.

BiEDK6jQESMt64t6N67jXg.text: Great food and drink selection. I recommend the poblano tacos, the beer battered avocado tacos, and the pitchers of the spicy margarita. Great place off the strip.

MiLYucLqu2AEUb4iU8pl_Q.text: I was in town for a conference, and rather than staying on the strip, I yelped a highly rated restaurant and behold, with a name like Tacos & Beer, we really couldn't go wrong. We took a cab over and discovered this gem. It was fairly dark in there, reminiscent of a dive bar, but much much cleaner.  First of all, our server, Noemi was amazing. She was super helpful, nice and happy. The four of us each ordered some beer, and a couple tacos.  The tacos were better than average. My taco standard is fairly high though. I thought the lengua tasted a little gamey, but the pastor and carnitas were good. I also thought it a little odd that the hot sauces are chilled. We also got the queso, which was awesome.  Also of note, the taco trays can be flipped upside down to accommodate 2 or 3 tacos! I'm guessing other people knew that already, but it kinda blew my mind.   If you get time to head off-strip and want some good tacos and a good beer list, head over here for some cheap eats and drinks with no BS service.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the wall decorations.
Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. queso!

JxqAAOmj1uda0-A4bsqx2A.text: Reminder that this is Vegas, therefore I enjoyed being able to come in at 1am. Late night work but you want to try what all the fuss is about...so we made it happen captain!  Umm, for starters we weren't greeted at the door. Servers and workers around glanced at us from afar, no one bother to come up. However the host seated us within two min. The restaurant itself is fairly small. It was not busy at the time. The lights were my most interesting thought about the environment! The setting was appropriate and matched the menu.   We were greeted by a guy by the name of Dennis. He we very quick and straight to the punch. Patient with me and my love as we had never been here before. He suggested a few things in drink and food menu. He was friendly and a good listener. My babes likes to talk peoples ears off so...lol   Long story short we got two beers and tacos with the a quick app. All which came in a matter of 5 min from each other. All of which tasted great. Tacos come single around 3 bucks each. We ordered bbq barbacoa, carnitas,fish and one with fried avocado. Super delicious especially with their homemade tortillas.   Lastly, we had a great time. Met nice people, it was almost two so even though we weren't rushed out it kinda felt like we had to since everyone wants to go home. All in all, good place to eat and chill with you and your friends or significant other. In my opinion, not meeting the hype or talk but certainly would come back.

yBJH41UehtXkeAarmntJag.text: Tacos are amazing, staff is great but especially Victor.  He is very much hands on with how your your food is.   We will definitely be back.

tfeUgu1KHXE0WNWduyrUKQ.text: Legitimately a good place to have lunch, great taco selection and real tasty stuff!  Its a recommend!

a4CdbKk_0xwrscUU-ddCWA.text: Another GREAT experience at T&B with Melissa and the outstanding Fernanda in charge. The place runs like a top with incredible service and an innovative menu with surprises and old favorites. I can't wait for the fall selection of unique cocktails debuting next month. The place has become a go to destination for just a good time.

KIQRnyxsovmET-dhspwz6Q.text: My fiance and I drove by this place while visiting Vegas for a weekend and decided to check it out. Good thing we did! We came here twice in a row cause both the service and the food was bomb! Our server Jessica was phenomenal and manager Mike was awesome !   Love the ambiance ! Go Jessica !

blIQzcDM6KKO6-kOU7aU_Q.text: Service was fantastic. Everyone was happy which is always a good thing. Food exceptional. Pricing; even on a taco Tuesday they reduce their prices on tacos .50cents. That's impressive. Only challenge we had was they redid the lighting outside and are still working on Lighting up the terrace seating so everything was pitch black. Didn't know what Tacos I was eating; thankfully they all were delicious! Lol   Side Bar: this plaza has sushi Mediterranean food vegan food & more. Great location

Av7Srs0fcUWj3RKx-k40lQ.text: We had an amazing time! Serena was super attentive! The food was delicious! ( I loved the avocado taco) THE BEST!!

Z8vfrHLC2-lBbLaKLauLlA.text: Came to this place for the first time.  My Lyft driver recommended it as I asked for a Mexican restaurant around my hotel.  I tried the carne asada taco, lengua taco and the queso fundido.  The food was amazingly good and I absolutely loveeedddddd the queso fundido.  Definitely recommend this place!

7Y8FavsWau3xLnLjZcjPFw.text: Vegan Tacos were Awesome.... I tried one of each... We had excellent service from Ethel

YAiAp5qs8_dBScndC5hn3g.text: Vegan Tacos!!!! They have 3 vegan tacos!!! When I saw this I was oh so happy, and naturally order all three.  They're cheap too!!  All three were so good and came out crazy fast.  The staff were all supper nice and they can make a damn good Margarita.  We split a pitcher and it was nice and strong.  You must stop in and try this place!

y1FQ7Go-tbIFJKW3uTw2Qg.text: My boyfriend and I met some friends here for taco Tuesday. Their special is simply $0.50 off the regular taco price which isn't much since their tacos mostly start at over $3 each. I do not care for tacos enough to pay that much but I was willing to give it a shot.  The service was quick. They were constantly refilling our drinks and chips, they never missed a beat.  The tacos I had were mediocre. Keep in mind this is simply preference and I just didn't care for these. The steak in my carne asada taco was dry and tough. The others were simply fine, but for the price I expected more.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos & Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oqILAg-Krrupw4v6ehc5aw.text: I'm so glad I found tacos & beer the first time I came was a few years back and I hadn't forgotten how bomb it was so I definitely had to come back.  The restaurant is very nice very clean with plenty of seating with a very popular patio area as well. But since it was full we had to sit inside no problem. Took a minute for a waiter to come over but it's all good we're on vacation. Our waiter was a really cool and relaxed guy he was super helpful as my dining companion had a bunch of questions.  So to start things off right we got the house margaritas One frozen the other on the rocks. Omg it was soo good you can tell they use fresh lime or an in-house mix because it was so flavorful and not overly sweet. As an appetizer we ordered the chips and salsa it came with a roasted tomato and an avocado tomatillo salsa it was absolutely delicious and definitely homemade. It wasn't spicy which I was kind of hoping it would be but if that's what you're into this would be perfect for you.  For my entree I ordered three tacos  The barbecue beef, the Carnitas, and the Baja fish all were amazing! My favorite had to be the barbecue beef with the mashed potatoes shredded lettuce and sour cream all the flavors combine perfectly and the crispy shell perfectly complemented this taco. The fish was delicious too it had to be my second favorite cooked perfectly w/flaky fish and slaw w/the lime crema and guac mixed it was perfect together overall great flavor. I wanted to try the Carnitas because the pictures looked so good. I thought it was OK but it was my last favorite I think it was because of the chicharrones they tasted too intestine like. Which lets me know they must be fresh and not from the bag like I'm used to.  Anyway all in all I can't wait to go back!

ZcPPJxkaJGjI_pf_mmumtg.text: Would give zero stars if possible. In short, terrible service and management was so rude to us. Never coming back.

lrMysRc2hIht378u9tslNQ.text: Chicken tinga empanada is one of my favorites, its delicious, I love this place because the food its grate, and they always have a good selections on beers, the staff is friendly and attentive, besides the atmosphere is comfortable and it's perfect if you want to come with friends totally recommended

RN-y3l0CJ61XTnxGnde9cA.text: I'm a fan! So many different types of tacos you can get from lengua, jackfruit, asada, shrimp pineapple, avocado, and even lettuce shell substitutes! Can't go wrong with cocktails, pitchers, & a large beer list including local beers. I enjoyed the carne asada fries (good side for 2-3 people) and jackfruit taco. My friend had me try her shrimp taco with lettuce shell instead of tortilla too. The shrimp is very flavorful! Our server was very friendly & knowledgeable about the beers. I wish I remembered his name so I could mention him, but next time I'm in town, I'll look for him.

zOARjZVeayQ4Dq7_SBbTag.text: Great place to eat and the service was excellent. Our waiter answered any question and let me try a sample of Jackfruit. Tacos were delicious and so was the guacamole. We went there two nights in a row.

AYJ8o5Ac9hHSRQgKntAPRw.text: It's Tuesday and you're hungry!   After a long and hot day at the Las Vegas Comic Con, I was hungry for tacos and wanted a chilly IPA in my hand, Tacos and Beer, I see you. First off, the outside is pretty deceiving, like most Las Vegas "snackateria's" it's located in a strip mall with a plain look and minimal signage, but when you walk-in it's dark, cool (temp wise) and has clean rustic-hipster look. I'm sold already.   I went with two tacos; a Fish Taco and the Pork al Pastor plus, chips and salsa, and bacon wrapped jalapenos. The Tacos were amazing, the al Pastor was super tender and the pineapple chunks went with the avocado cream sauce perfectly, great sweet and savory combo. The Fish taco was not fried, but grilled which sometimes can lack in flavor, but this time around that was not the case. Flaky fish, habanero-mango salsa, and cilantro, boom. Definitely a good choice if you're looking for "lighter" taco option.   The Bacon-wrapped Jalapenos were huge and stuffed with cream cheese and came with a guajillo chili sauce. These were a hit it on all cylinders for me, even if it meant I would be paying for it later on in bathroom.   The service was fast and our waiter knew the beer menu very well, he even mentioned a few beers that weren't on the list, but were still available. If you haven't been here yet, the beer list is pretty extensive, so for him to memorize the entire beer wall menu and know the taps was pretty impressive.   Tacos and Beer, You have made your namesake proud
